job_descriptions.db27839785a0d533:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timePart-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout The Brand: Pluto TV, a ViacomCBS company, is the leading free streaming television service in America, delivering 250+ live and original channels and thousands of on-demand movies in partnership with major TV networks, movie studios, publishers, and digital media companies. Pluto TV is available on all mobile, web and connected TV streaming devices and millions of viewers tune in each month to watch premium news, TV shows, movies, sports, lifestyle, and trending digital series. Headquartered in West Hollywood, Pluto TV has offices in New York, Silicon Valley, Chicago and Berlin. Overview and Responsibilities:

Pluto TV's UX and Product Design team is currently looking for a UX Designer to join the team. Working closely with a Senior UX Designer, the UX Designer will be crafting and testing features for various platforms that host the Pluto TV service in order to improve user engagement and retention.
The role will report to the Senior Director of Product Design.
Responsibilities
This is a meaningful role with a wide range of responsibilities, including:
Transforming high-level solutions to complex user experience problems to well defined, accessible, and easy-to-use designs.
Presenting the user experience at various stages of the design process by using wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity click through prototypes.
Implementing and improving the Pluto design system across multiple device types, screen sizes, and languages.
Building experiences optimized for our various connected television platforms.
Basic Qualifications:
At least 1 year of commercial product designer experience as part of a design team.
Record of collaboration with distributed teams.
Demonstrated contribution to design systems.
Proficiency with design tools such as, or similar to, Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD.
Please include a link to your portfolio/website.
job_descriptions.db347273bff9c20a:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionYou Have:

Industry experience in UX design or related creative discipline.
Curiosity and a learning
An aesthetic sense
Empathy for the people using your software or products

About Us:
Launched in 2011, Twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the interactions of millions. We bring the joy of co-op to everything, from casual gaming to world-class esports to anime marathons, music, and art streams. Twitch also hosts TwitchCon, where we bring everyone together to celebrate, learn, and grow their personal interests and passions. We're always live at Twitch. Stay up to date on all things Twitch on Linkedin, Twitter and on our Blog.

About the Role:
Twitch's community of streamers and viewers are at the heart of everything we build. The Twitch Advertising and Promotions product team is tasked with redefining these experiences for viewers, streamers, and advertisers. We are creating advertising products that support and sustain creators, engage their viewers in shared experiences, and help advertisers reach new audiences and potential customers.
We are looking for a curious, and creative designer that is ready to tackle big problems. As a User Experience Designer at Twitch, you will produce high-quality experiences which bring joy to people all over the world. UX designers are involved in every step of the process, from early ideation and definition with Product Managers and User Researchers, through to working with engineering to ensure the final product exceeds customer expectations.

You Will:

Collaborate with a development team of product managers, engineers, and designers
Learn from streamers and viewers about the ways they use our services and their desires to accomplish more
Think creatively about how to sustain streamers' communities
Give back to the design community at Twitch by using and improving existing patterns and approaches
Combine qualitative and quantitative information to develop hypotheses about customer motivations and use that to improve your designs
Present your work to others by participating in design reviews and feedback sessions

Bonus Points:

Experience working on consumer software products
Accomplished research plans talking to customers
Knowledge of design systems
Expertise with Figma
Formal education in Design, Interaction/UX Design or HCI
Knowledge of prototyping tools or proficiency in front-end code (HTML/CSS/JS)

Perks:

Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
401(k), Maternity & Parental Leave
Flexible PTO
Commuter Benefits
Amazon Employee Discount
Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages),
Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner Served Daily
Free Snacks & Beverages

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job_descriptions.4f7e548e2296a623:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionABOUT ROCKSET
Rockset’s vision is to make the world more data driven. Building powerful data applications today requires a combination of complex interdependent data management systems that often resembles a Rube Goldberg machine of sorts. At Rockset, we imagine a world where developers and data scientists go from complex data sets to fast interactive applications and analysis effortlessly, within minutes. Rockset is built by experts with decades of experience in web-scale data management and distributed systems. Our team comprises engineers who helped create the online data and search infrastructure at Facebook, founded the Hadoop Filesystem project at Yahoo, implemented the Gmail backend and Kubernetes at Google, and built databases at Oracle.

We're a fast-growing company. We value curiosity, diversity, and open-mindedness. You will solve interesting problems, surrounded by exceptional people, while making customers happy. We work hard, but also take our personal lives and experiences seriously. We are backed by Greylock Partners and Sequoia Capital, and headquartered in San Mateo, CA with offices in Boston, MA and London, UK.


Key Qualifications
Experience in user-centered design with hands on experience throughout the process, from user research to developing prototypes and collaborating on implementation.
Experience in delivering wireframes, UX flows, mockups, interactive prototypes, design specifications final assets as well as personas and use case development.
Ability and passion to understand distinct user groups quickly and iterate solutions to their needs.Work with a cross functional team, partnering with users, product owners and development teams to deliver business value.
• Expert knowledge with design/wireframing software such as: Sketch, Adobe suite, or equivalent. • Familiarity with prototyping/animation tools such as: Principle, Axure, Figma, or equivalent.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
job_descriptions.3f90f8de3315361b:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout Gap Inc.
Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.
This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our team is made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.
About the role
As a member of our User Experience Team @Gap you’ll experience and drive scale, impact and innovation. As one of the largest multi-branded global retailers, we’re amongst the handful of competitors who can – and must – be at the forefront of great digital experiences to thrive. We have a proprietary digital engine, integrated with a set of industry-leading third parties, that helps drive strong customer experience and is core to our customer strategy.
Gap, Inc. is looking for a UX Designer, Omni Experience and Loyalty. In this role, you will be a visual designer and skilled interaction professional. You will work with cross-functional partners to improve the user experience across Gap, Old Navy, Banana Republic, and Athleta.
You will work across multiple areas of UX, starting with our integrated cross-brand loyalty program. You should demonstrate strong interaction and visual design skills and be able to collaborate with a dynamic team across multiple touchpoints.
You will own specific touchpoints and process flows and help guide test and learn design sprints alongside other UX designers on your team. Additionally, you will facilitate communication between UX team members, Brand leaders, Store Operations, Loyalty and Payments team and technology partners to ensure outstanding, holistic user experience is being taken into account.
What you'll do
Execute on a holistic end-to-end user experience vision across multiple platforms.
Develop conceptual diagrams, wireframes, visual mockups, click-throughs, and prototypes.
Use business requirements, user research to assist in developing scenarios, use cases, and high-level requirements.
Anticipate evolving customer and store associate needs and how the organization can address them with current or new products/services.
Be a member of workshops and design sprints with project teams and stakeholders to explore problem spaces, identify new opportunities and create alignment.
Collaborate closely with Product Management and Loyalty and Payments teams to design user requirements and flows.
Take direction from Sr UX designers on the team, while furthering your own design and communication skills.
Who you are
You have 2-4 years of professional UX Design experience.
You live and breathe lean design methodology, design thinking and experimentation.
You think about design in your spare time and are naturally curious about better ways to do things.
You are visual and consider pixels your friend.
You enjoy systems thinking and service design.
You demonstrate that you deeply care for the craft and have impeccable attention for details while distilling the design components and patterns to compose a system.
You are looking to grow your career in a supportive organization and champion the user experience in everything you do.
Notice to applicants in San Francisco: Gap Inc. and its related brands will consider for employment, qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. The Fair Chance Ordinance is provided here: English Spanish Chinese Tagalog
Benefits at Gap Inc.
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*
Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*
Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*
Employee stock purchase plan.*
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*
See more of the benefits we offer.
For eligible employees
Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Humans Rights Campaign for the fourteenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2019 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the second year in a row.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionNextEra Energy Resources is one of the largest wholesale generators of electric power and renewable energy from the wind and sun in North America.
Position Specific Description
NextEra Energy is seeking a well-qualified candidate who is passionate about driving the clean energy revolution by providing solar companies with innovative software. As a product designer, you will be asked to:
Work closely with customers and other NextEra Energy teams to develop smart and creative software solutions to the problems our customers face and ensure NextEra Energy is delivering modern, easy to use and intuitive software
Produce designs for all new software products and enhancements, including lo-fi mocks, hi-fi mocks, and prototypes for A/B testing
Develop polished and professional designs for the NextEra Energy website, marketing collateral, and all external training materials
Job Overview
This position will be responsible for all frontend design aspects of software development for solar companies using NextEra Energy software to design, sell, finance, and install projects. This role will require a keen eye for creating simple, easy to use, eye-catching UI / UX designs for B2B customers as well as consumers.
Job Duties
Work closely with customers to understand their use of the software, gathering user requirements in collaboration with product managers
Work cross-functionally with product, engineer, sales, and operations to successfully deliver new platform designs that emphasize ease of use and aesthetic quality
Participate in collaborative design sessions with product managers and software engineers
Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows, and sitemaps
Develop UI mockups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and what they will look like
Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs, and widgets
Build page navigation buttons and search fields
Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches, and tables) for us in a variety of contexts
Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness) using tools like Fullstory and Sentry and present proposed solutions
Conduct A/B testing and adjust designs appropriately based on user feedback
Create and maintain style guides, leading the standardization of fonts, colors and images across the platform and in all NextEra Energy materials
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
3+ years of UI / UX design experience at a software company
Experience with B2B software; experience in the solar or renewable energy field a plus
Unmatched eye for quality, beauty, and detail; a commitment to developing software that pushes the envelope in terms of function, ease-of-use, and aesthetic quality
Strong time and process management skills with proven ability to meet deadlines and successfully deliver on complex projects
Strong understanding of software development practices, coding, and software architecture; past coding or product management experience a plus
The skills to develop, implement, and manage scalable processes
A positive attitude and a strong desire to always get the job done in spite of obstacles
The ability to work independently as well as collaborate in a team-oriented and fast-paced environment
A high level of energy, motivation, initiative, commitment, and professionalism
Job Overview
This job is responsible for creating great user experiences on the web and other digital channels. Individuals work cross-functionally and collaboratively to design the graphical user interface and experience for applications and web sites. Employees in this role guide developers through fulfilling the design experience.
Job Duties & Responsibilities
Collaborates with product management and developers to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals, and experience
Executes all visual design stages from concept to a collaborative hand-off with software developers
Conceptualizes original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks
Works with developers to modify HTML, CSS, and JavaScript concepts of web applications to align with designed experience
Demonstrates both user interface and user experience concepts to product management
Performs other job-related duties as assigned
Required Qualifications
High School Grad / GED
Bachelor’s or Equivalent Experience
Experience: 5+ years
Preferred Qualifications
None
Employee Group: Exempt
Employee Type: Full Time
Job Category: Information Technology
Organization: NextEra Project Mgmt
Location: San Diego, California
Other Work Locations: California; Texas
Relocation Provided: Yes, if applicable
NextEra Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, age, national origin, religion, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetics, disability, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionSenior Associate UX Designer
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.
We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents.
A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
Responsibilities
Develops a range of UX deliverables, including task flows, information architecture (IA) diagrams, design studies, wireframes, and high-fidelity interface mockups
Participates in design reviews with colleagues and stakeholders Visual/UI Design
Designs and delivers visual mockups, layouts, and specifications for a site/application's look and feel (color, shape, typography, etc.)
Contributes to design specifications and style guides
Collaborates with development teams to ensure specifications are understood and implemented UX Strategy/SME Consultation
Applies critical thinking to a variety of complex user problems, taking into account user needs, business objectives and technical constraints
Produces visual and/or interaction design components for use in clickable UI walkthroughs or code prototypes Produces UX deliverables for user focus groups and data collection
Observes user research sessions
Leverages and consumes user research data in the creation of UX deliverables Information Architecture
Develops navigation structures to support proper wayfinding
Structures and classifies sites and applications to help people find and manage information
Designs an information space to facilitate task completion and intuitive access to content Interaction Design
Qualifications
3+ years experience preferred
Bachelor's degree preferred
Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disabilities.
job_descriptions.00ae663358d04735:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionGlidewell Laboratories, Inc. provides products and services to dental professionals in the United States and internationally. We are focused on building innovative technology for our customers to make better decisions that improve patient outcomes. We value our culture by encouraging growth, collaboration, and constructive debate as well as delivering innovative solutions.
As a core member of the cloud team, you will work closely with the business to build cutting-edge solutions following the agile development process. This is an opportunity to join a growing team of talented individuals focused on using the latest technology to address complex real world problems currently impacting the dental industry.
As a UX Designer, you will:
Facilitates user product visions for digital products through research, wireframe, sketch, prototype, and mockup of user experiences.
Facilitates product design throughout the entire design process: research, ideate, sketch, prototype, and user tests
Identifies user requirements through research and analysis of user needs, preferences, objectives, and work methods.
Designs and delivers wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups optimized for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
Formulates visual style guide, design artifacts, and interaction standards.
Collaborates with teams to plan usability testing sessions; identifies participants for usability testing.
Informs design decisions through utilization of user insight, analytics, best practice, and competitor analysis.
Analyzes and incorporates user feedback and activity to enhance user experience.
Interested in working with us? You will have:

Bachelor’s degree in the field of Cognitive Science, Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Interaction Design, or similar.
Minimum two (2) years in a UX-related role, or any equivalent education and/or experience from which comparable knowledge, skills and abilities have been demonstrated/achieved.
Experience with design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Xd, Sketch, Framer, and Adobe Creative Cloud required.
Experience with analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Amplitude, and Hotjar, a plus.
HTML/CSS and Javascript experience preferred but not required.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timePart-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout The Brand: Pluto TV, a ViacomCBS company, is the leading free streaming television service in America, delivering 250+ live and original channels and thousands of on-demand movies in partnership with major TV networks, movie studios, publishers, and digital media companies. Pluto TV is available on all mobile, web and connected TV streaming devices and millions of viewers tune in each month to watch premium news, TV shows, movies, sports, lifestyle, and trending digital series. Headquartered in West Hollywood, Pluto TV has offices in New York, Silicon Valley, Chicago and Berlin. Overview and Responsibilities:

Pluto TV's UX and Product Design team is currently looking for a Senior UX Designer to join the team. This person will be owning the design of features for various platforms that host the Pluto TV service in order to improve user engagement and retention.
The role will report to the Senior Director of Product Design.
Responsibilities
This is a meaningful role with a wide range of responsibilities, including:
Lead the design of cross-platform features while collaborating with platform specific teams for implementation and iterative improvements.
Break down complex problems to find the discrete and actionable solutions required for our agile product organisation.
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process, in person and asynchronously, through wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity prototypes, and task tracking tools.
Make evidence based arguments for problem definitions and solutions.
Inform success metrics for design solutions.
Basic Qualifications:

We believe these are the key requirements to be successful:
At least 5 years of commercial product designer experience as part of a design team with a high degree of autonomy while working closely with product and design teams to solve complex problems.
Ability to effectively define and delegate tasks to UI designers.
Experience with collaborative Lean UX frameworks.
Experience creating and synthesizing unmoderated usability tests.
Demonstrated success using design systems across multiple platforms.
Record of influencing successful high-profile, highly-visible information architecture decisions.
Experience making significant contributions creating multivariate tests to inform or validate features.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Create visually stunning, frictionless, engaging and usable product experiences for life sciences users.
Demonstrate strategic design-thinking principles to help create performant, next-level user interface solutions across desktop, tablet and mobile products.
Use the latest quantitative and qualitative user research techniques to provide business and user-focused strategy recommendations.
Conduct competitive analyses of similar commercial digital product experiences.
Build storyboards to convey project plans, plus track and report usability goals for senior management.
Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes for intuitive user experiences.
Research and user-test digital product experiences.
Understands and evangelizes product, individual, and team success.
Responsible for communicating lessons learned, and supporting a culture of learning
Self-starter, comfortable working in a highly collaborative, cross-functional environment, demonstrating an open-mind and a critical eye for professional aesthetics and detail.
Solve complex user and business challenges.
Can easily adapt within a fast-paced and constantly changing environment.

TRAINING RESPONSIBILITIES:
Complete all assigned and required training satisfactorily and on time
For people managers, ensure your associates attend and complete all required trainings satisfactorily and on time.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Education and Experience (in years):
Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Information Design, Human Factors, or equivalent work experience with 8+ years of related work experience OR Master’s degree in field with 6+ years of related work experience OR Doctoral degree in field with 3+ years of work experience.
5-10+ years’ experience leading projects for digital media experiences (web, mobile, apps, etc.) using user-centered design practices.

Knowledge and skills:
Lead the creation of design concepts to demonstrate a holistic vision.
Present design concepts and communicate the design rationale behind creative decisions in a highly collaborative environment.
Lead user testing sessions to create the best design by personas.
Translate user research, market research, and live-site analytics into design concepts that meet or exceed business objectives.

Experience in practical user research, usability testing and consumer insight gathering.
Familiarity with Agile methodology.
Working knowledge of front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, Angular, etc.) a plus.

job_descriptions.06dabb5c0b25de87:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWe are looking for a talented UX Designer to help with the design for our hit mobile game “Choices: Stories You Play.” Choices is equal parts “app” and “game”, and you will be designing assets and features for both. This is a full-time position based in Mountain View, CA.
You would be working with a highly seasoned team, one that believes in delivering category-leading games that touch millions. Our employees are passionate about our players, and as a result, some players refer to our studio as “family.” They love our games’ focus on racial, gender, sexual, and identity diversity and hold us accountable when they expect more.
We love what we do and are looking for someone who wants to grow with us.
This would be for a full time, eventually on-site position in Mountain View, CA. Pre-covid, we worked from home two times a week, so our team is used to the productivity of remote work but also cares about building culture from in-office interactions.
Responsibilities

Work closely with our Lead and Senior Designers on app and game features for Choices: Stories You Play.

Create deliverables such as wireframes, app flows, high and low fidelity UI mockups, interactive prototypes, icons and optimized game ready assets.

Execute on all design stages from concept to final delivery.

Conceptualize ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design.

Collaborate with artists and developers to transform concepts into a highly polished experience.

Clearly communicate your designs through use of sketches, feature documentation, mockups, and prototypes.

Meticulously test and validate designs in-game and create testing guidelines for QA.

Contribute throughout the whole lifecycle of game development shipping fun, innovative features played by millions.

Qualifications

3+ years of professional design experience.

Excellent UI design and visual design skills.

Excellent vector icon design skills.

Fluency in responsive app design.

Ability to find multiple high-quality, valid solutions to design problems.

Mastery of Photoshop, Sketch, Figma or equivalent software.

Strong grasp of modern app design patterns.

Must be able to receive direction and make changes to designs as requested.

Proven experience working on games or apps in a professional environment.

Experience with animation or building interactive prototypes.

Good analytical, interpersonal, and problem solving skills.

Positives

Regular player of mobile story games, especially Choices and its competitors.

A great attitude and desire to work in a team environment.

Highly organized.

Not afraid to ask for help.
Materials Requested

A cover letter indicating why you're interested in the position

Resume
job_descriptions.3b01aba822c98b3a:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJoin our Winning Team as a UX Designer

(Position open to current Ontario residents only)
When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” is taken to new heights. Even today, while working remotely, our culture is strong and our team is connected.
CARFAX is growing and seeking an experienced UX Designer who is looking for a new opportunity with a GREAT company. Our ideal candidate will have proven experience designing interfaces that provide value to our customers.
This position is full time and based in Ontario. Open to considering remote Ontario candidates who are willing to travel several times a quarter to our London, Ontario office.
As a UX Designer, you will:
Work every day with a team of product managers, user experience researchers and developers across the business to understand and solve business and user problems.
Design intuitive, results driven products and thoughtful user experiences that balance aesthetics and usability.
Leverage research findings and analytics data to inform design decisions and evaluate the effectiveness of designs.
Prototype to demonstrate and evaluate potential designs with stakeholders.
Work within an Agile team environment that delivers through iteration.
Listen and sharing with colleagues across the company to drive collaboration.
Know the possibilities and limitations of current development approaches for responsive web interfaces.
Illustrate a firm grasp of the user centered design process (Strategy, Research, Design and Testing), and being able to lead the product team through the various stages.
In a given week, our UX Designers might be:
Leading a whiteboard session with the rest of the project team (product manager, developers, etc.) to brainstorm designs.
Creating user workflows or information architecture for a complex new feature.
Working with UX Researchers to evaluate proposed features or products through user testing.
Facilitate workshops with the product team to help evaluate which product concepts to build out.
To be considered for this role, you will need:
5+ years of experience designing responsive interfaces across multiple platforms (web, native apps, etc).
Have a degree, certification, or equivalent work experience showing aptitude with User Experience.
Be proficient in using design tools such as the Sketch, Invision, and Adobe Creative Suite.
The ability to travel to the U.S. approximately 4-5 times a year
Have an online portfolio of UX work samples you can share with us.*Please Note: an online portfolio is required for consideration.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionUX Designer
Location: Santa Clara, CA
At Edelman Financial Engines, we believe every hardworking American deserves to move their financial life forward, and we’re growing our team so we can help more clients every day.
As part of the Product & Technology organization at Edelman Financial Engines (EFE) our designers play a key role embedded within product squads and have the skills necessary to deliver effective solutions for our financial planners and clients.
As a Designer on our Planner Experiences team you’ll join our agile environment with a highly collaborative, cross functional team. As an advocate for our team of planners, you’ll transform their needs, cares, and worries into designs that will help both our current and future customers.
Responsibilities:
Develop a clear understanding, and advocate for the needs of our planners in partnership with product, engineering, research, content and design.
Build wireframes and flows to conceptualize designs to accurately convey user journey.
Create designs and prototypes that bring concepts and ideas to life, enable decision making and building consensus.
Support the design team by supporting and contributing to a common design system, developing standards, best practices and guidelines where necessary.
Contribute to designs across multiple product lines and platforms including web, iOS and Android.
Present a solid rationale for design decisions, leveraging best practices, common frameworks or guidelines.
Participate in design sessions with teams and stakeholders, offering and providing feedback on concepts and ideas to inform or evolve the customer experience.
Requirements:
Skilled with industry design tools such as Figma, Adobe, Sketch and Zeplin
Good understanding of the fundamentals of design, UX principles, best practices (including ADA compliance) and all phases of the design process.
Solid understanding of the use of design systems and libraries to effectively manage and scale.
Ability to prioritize and manage several milestones and projects efficiently.
Degree in related design or UX field or equivalent experience.
Online portfolio demonstrating work is required.
About Edelman Financial Engines
Since 1986, Edelman Financial Engines has been committed to always acting in the best interest of our clients. We were founded on the belief that all American investors – not just the wealthy – deserve access to personalized, comprehensive financial planning and investment advice. Today, we are America’s top independent financial planning and investment advisor, as recognized by Barron’s1, with 150+ planner offices across the country and entrusted by more than 1.2 million clients to manage more than $260 billion in assets2. Our unique approach to serving clients combines our advanced methodology and proprietary technology with the attention of a dedicated personal financial planner. Every client’s situation and goals are unique, and the powerful fusion of high-tech and high-touch allows Edelman Financial Engines to deliver the personal plan and financial confidence that everyone deserves.
For more information, visit www.EdelmanFinancialEngines.com

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionRole Overview
SolidProfessor is looking to add a UX/UI Designer to join our team in creating exceptional learning experiences for our members. You’ll use your strong visual and interaction design skills to help students, teachers, and professionals reach their goals. You can expect to be involved in every step of the process - researching solutions, interacting with members, creating user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.
At SolidProfessor we value cultural fit as much as creativity and technical know-how. We’re looking for someone who can advance UX best practices and evolve our product with our members’ best interests in mind.
To be successful here you should be an excellent communicator, be able to debate ideas in pursuit of the best solution, and do so in a respectful and humble way. As a team we’re always open to new ideas, new tools, and new processes, so you should be comfortable in an environment that demands quick and constant learning.
We would prefer candidates local to our downtown San Diego office, but are open to remote candidates who would work PST hours. For the duration of the COVID 19 pandemic, you would be working remotely with no expectation of travel or in-person availability. Post pandemic, were you remote, there may be a need for occasional travel.
About Solidprofessor
Solidprofessor is a company that teaches engineers and designers how to use the tools of their trade. We produce thousands of hours of on-demand guided tutorials covering a wide range of topics, and deliver them using our own internally developed learning platform. Our members include thirty thousand (and counting), professionals, students, and anyone looking to build valuable skills in engineering and design disciplines.
Our office is located in Downtown San Diego’s Little Italy neighborhood where our team contributes to a fun, casual, and hard-working environment. We value innovation, ownership, excellence, and respect. If you’re interested in working with a team that shares these values, we encourage you to submit your resume. We’d love to meet you!
Responsibilities
Play a key role in transforming high-level product roadmap initiatives into robust features that fully serve the needs of our members
Compile research, create user flows, wireframe solutions, mockup UIs and design experiences
Work closely with both technical and non-technical stakeholders to come up with robust solutions to complex user experience challenges
Define and maintain UX specifications and standards across all user facing web apps
Keep up with the latest trends and techniques in design, UI, and UX
Learn and implement new technologies and help evolve existing ones
Minimum Qualifications
Minimum of 2 years of UX/UI design experience producing engaging, usable, and effective design solutions using user-centric principles
Portfolio displaying strong skills in UX and workflow design
Knowledge of user centered design principles and practices, web standards, responsive design, typography and color, and web usability standards
Proficiency with wireframe and visual design tools
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including ability to clearly articulate your ideas and receive constructive feedback from peers
An obsessive eye for interaction and visual details
Ability to think at a high level about product strategy and vision
Comfort in a fast-paced and often changing environment, with an inclination to solve new problems and learn new skills in order to succeed
Preferred Qualifications
UX/UI design experience in a team environment, particularly with a high level of interaction with other teams in the organization
Experience conducting end-to-end UX research, including usability testing
Knowledge of design systems and related methodologies such as Atomic Design
Experience working within an Agile UX environment using Lean UX or similar methodology

job_descriptions.cf35e7b128452e16:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionUX Designer – DICE LA

We are DICE Los Angeles

DICE LA was founded in 2013 with a mission to create outstanding entertainment, and to do so in a manner that is different from the rest of the industry. We want to make great games, and be great at making games.

What does that mean to you as a developer?

It means that you will have a creative stake in everything you do. We believe that we are all game makers, and everyone at our studio contributes to the goal of making amazing game experiences, regardless of role or title. We want this to be the studio where you do the best work of your career. We also firmly believe that we are at our best when we have the proper balance between work and life. To support this balance, we nurture a culture that aims to reach the highest productivity without crunch, and by making smart decisions when it comes to how we work and plan. Having a positive, inclusive studio culture is of extreme importance to us.

Our games reflect the means by which they are created. Games that are crafted in an inspiring atmosphere, with creativity, artistry and technology as their backbone, will capture the imagination of gamers around the world.

We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced UX Designer like you, to join us in our mission to create amazing games and experiences, and to elevate ourselves and our craft. You will work on an exciting new project at the studio, and report to the Design Line Manager at DICE's Los Angeles office.

Responsibilities:
Take direction from the lead UX designer, to take UX-heavy features from concept to completion on a large project
Design concepts, wireframes, and prototypes, while iterating based on your research, team feedback, and user feedback
Create process flows, wireframes, and visual design mockups to effectively conceptualize and communicate detailed interaction behaviors for multiple environments and audiences
Work within Frostbite engine to implement your work through iterative prototyping, ensuring they make for the best possible player experience
Collaborate closely with other designers and engineers, to understand and help define UX goals for new and evolving features
Push to improve UX design workflow processes

Requirements:
3+ years of experience in UX design, at least 1 year in game UX
At least one shipped game as a UX designer; console development experience is a plus
Comfortable with technical implementation; using game editors, scripting languages and tools
Passion for games and user-centered design, and a fascination for understanding how users experience a product
Advanced knowledge of digital tools for creating UX and IxD deliverables
Understands the importance of documentation and teaching others
Enjoys problem-solving with a creative team
Values documentation and healthy communication
Broad taste in games

Valuable additional skills:
A gamer with excellent understanding of how meta-games are structured and designed
Degree in Interaction Design, Psychology, Human Factors, Industrial Engineering or related HCI discipline
Proficiency in user experience design tools (Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe XD, Axure, Omnigraffle)

Benefits

We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes world-class people to make world-class games, we offer competitive compensation packages and a culture that thrives on creativity and individuality.

Next Steps

As part of the application process we might ask you to perform a practical design exercise. Apply online with a resume and portfolio.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionSaviynt is a leading provider of Cloud Security and Identity Governance solutions. Saviynt enables enterprises to secure applications, data, and infrastructure in a single platform for Cloud (Office 365, AWS, Azure, Salesforce, Workday) and Enterprise (SAP, Oracle EBS). Saviynt is pioneering Identity Governance Administration by integrating advanced risk analytics and intelligence with fine-grained privilege management.
Delivering the next-generation user interface and experience is a top priority for us as we transform into a design-led software company. We are looking for talented UX designers that are passionate about creating modern experiences for our platform. Our designers have exceptional autonomy to work with the product engineering team to invent cutting edge user experiences using modern principles and practices. Your work will immediately reach a large number of end-users and will be visible at the industry level.
Responsibilities:
Lead a collaborative design process for Saviynt product portfolio using data-informed design practices, user research, and market needs
Create storyboards and wireframes to communicate and validate designs with stakeholders
Produce user-centric designs by creating user journey maps and developing personas
Create and own a design guide to ensure a cohesive and consistent design across the platform
Basic Qualifications:
Master degree in Interaction Design, Human-Computer Interaction Design, or related product design field
1- 2 years experience in web-based product design
A portfolio website representing sample work
Ability to create and present wireframes to present workflows, layouts, and interactions
Proficiency with UX design tools such as Sketch and Adobe XD
Understand and practice user-centric design principles
Responsible for the design lifecycle, great initiative to improve design with iterations
Willing to work remotely with teammates and stakeholders in different time zones
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong capability to understand complex data structure, provide design options on diverse hierarchies and do reasonable validation
Experience with motion graphics and UI animations for web apps
Experience with enterprise web-based products focused on platform administration
Experience with HTML and CSS and front-end prototyping
Experience with user research and data collection to guide design
Knowledge of database and programming
Knowledge of Identity and Access Management or Cybersecurity domain experience will be considered as a significant advantage
Benefits:
 Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance
 401K
 Unlimited PTO
 Sick Time
 Holiday Parties
 Daily Catered Lunches
 Employee Recognition Programs
 Team Socials
Saviynt is an amazing place to work. We are leading an industry, experiencing rocket ship growth, and have some of the most brilliant and talented people working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you!

Job detailsSalary$25 - $27 an hourJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Title: UX Designer
Location: Tustin, CA
Status: Full Time
About the role
The UX Designer will assist in implementing new or improved website features and functionality to drive overall ecommerce sales and further evolve the BCP brand.
What you’ll be doing
Assists with maintaining design and development for our ecommerce platform (Web - desktop and mobile experiences)
Analyze user feedback and activity; conduct interviews and surveys, then use the gathered information to create style guides, sitemaps, wireframes and user flows
Use A/B testing tools to execute tests on underperforming webpages
Work closely with developers to ensure websites designs and functions are being implemented to specifications and working properly
Collaborate with internal teams to improve processes and troubleshoot issues
Perform other duties as required and assigned by manager and upper management
What we’re looking for
You’ll need to have:
Minimum 1-3 years in design, graphic design, computer science, human-computer interaction, or related fields
Proficient in Design software: We use Sketch, InVision, Zeplin here! We also utilize Adobe Creative Suite (including but not limited to Photoshop, Illustrator and Xd)
Strong Portfolio demonstrating a range of work in user experience, interaction design
Great communicator: You can communicate the story of your designs to peers and leadership
Strong visual background with the aptitude to learn
Collaborative & Team Player: You will work with multiple departments to achieve success. No egos here!
Impact Driven: You design with a purpose and aim to provide excellent digital experiences for users

Complete Application
Resume

Fast forward about 18 years, Best Choice Products has transformed from a small-scale business operating out of a garage to a thriving and diverse e-commerce brand. BCP aims to be a one stop shop for every household needs. Our categories range from home goods, outdoor lawn & patio to seasonal décor, toys, musical instruments and more!
We are growing at an immense rate and therefore have opened up multiple warehouse operations strategically located throughout the US. BCP has figured out the recipe for success and therefore has earned its ranking as a top seller on marketplaces such as Amazon and Walmart.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionOur mission at Oura is empowering every individual to own their inner potential. Our award-winning products, the Oura Ring and its accompanying app, helps our global community gain a deeper understanding of their health, lifestyle, and sleep quality, which we believe are foundational to living a healthy, fulfilled life.

Oura is looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer to join our team and help us evolve our core product experience, with a focus on our mobile apps. In this role, you’ll work on high visibility projects that bring Oura users actionable insights to improve their health and wellbeing, build community among users, grow this powerful product to a broader audience, and constantly make Oura's UX clearer, more informative, and more enjoyable to use.

This role is based in San Francisco, or remote anywhere in the US.

What You will do:
Design UX & UI for Oura mobile apps, focusing on evolving our core features and primary surfaces
Work closely with product managers and developers to test, iterate, and continually innovate Oura’s mobile experience
Create wireframes, build prototypes, and deliver pixel-perfect visual designs to grow user engagement and improve user outcomes
Collaborate and share feedback with Oura’s product design team to maintain brand consistency across channels
Requirements

We would love to have you on our team, if you have:
3+ years experience as a UI/UX designer, preferably for a mass market mobile application
A portfolio showcasing high quality, thoughtful UI and UX work
Excellent prototyping skills
A proven track record of working collaboratively and effectively with cross-functional teams. Experience working with international groups and distributed teams a big plus
Comprehensive knowledge of mobile design patterns (and when to break them)
Benefits

At Oura, we care about you and your wellbeing. Everyone here at Oura has a ring of their own and are continually looking to improve their health and add to our benefits!

What we offer:
Competitive salary and equity
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Wellness benefits
Flexible working hours + work-life balance
An Oura ring of your own
Beautiful workspace in San Francisco by Pier 31
20 days of PTO
Amazing culture of collaborative and passionate coworkers

Oura is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Individuals seeking employment at Oura are considered without regards to age, ancestry, color, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, socioeconomic status, protected family care or medical leave status, race, religion (including beliefs and practices or the absence thereof), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionSummary
Posted: Mar 9, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200227424
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.
WW Ops BI is seeking a senior designer with a real passion for phenomenal user experience design and an exceptional eye for detail. The senior designer will conceive, design and develop the user experience strategy for the WW and regional BI teams. We're looking for a visually articulate designer capable of communicating their ideas through compelling high-fidelity illustrations, frameworks and prototypes. You will have a high influence and impact to the way we visualize data and information in the business.
Key Qualifications
Applied experience in user experience design
Demonstrable understanding of visual and user experience design disciplines and principles
Experience applying user experience design principles to data and information visualization in the business
Familiarity with various BI reporting, analytics & visualization products such as Business Objects, Corda, OBIEE, Tableau, etc. preferred
Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop and Illustrator in particular) and other design tools
Critical eye for attention to detail and pixel perfection
Capable of rendering high fidelity layouts and icons
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently in a dynamic environment
Excellent collaboration skills
Ability to deliver high quality work on tight schedules
Document UX specifications, design and standards
Able to lead multiple projects and tasks at a time
Description
The core responsibility for this role is to build a rich, engaging and consistent experience for the business across all BI solutions in Operations. This includes conceiving, developing and prototyping new visualizations and interactions for various BI developed solutions, then working with worldwide and regional teams to finalize designs, documenting solutions and participating in their implementation. We are looking for a great teammate with superb communication, negotiation and presentation skills. Strong leadership skills are critical to the success of this role.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant and equivalent industry experience required.
Additional Requirements
Must be able to provide sample work as requested
job_descriptions.f1cf3cf6f0288ad2:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWe are looking for a senior user experience (UX) designer who can design user-centered and straightforward solutions for our enterprise web applications. The candidate should be passionate about resolving user pain points through superior design.
At Tesla, the UX designer will be responsible for developing the overall user-experience functionality of our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), mobile, and both internal/external facing web applications. The candidate should understand business requirements, analyze technical limitations, perceive and conduct research on user behavior, and translate them into user stories, user journey maps, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes. At the same time, the UX designer should ensure a great user experience and iterate upon the designs with user-testing.
Responsibilities
Interact with business users and product management team regularly and convert their ideas into concepts.
Develop and deliver wireframes, user journeys, mockups, and prototypes optimized for a wide range of hardware devices and interfaces.
Participate in design discussions along with product management teams. Provide walkthroughs and demos on user journeys, mockups, and other deliverables to the development team, business stakeholders, and product teams.
Conduct research, conceive, sketch, prototype, and test user experiences for data-heavy web applications such as Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and other business-centric web sites.
Make strategic design and user-experience decisions for both web and mobile applications.
Take a user-centered design (UCD) approach to develop UX solutions. Rapidly test and iterate designs without slipping the deadlines.
Collaborate with business stakeholders via a distributed model to seek approval of design solutions regularly.
Conduct usability tests on each application, module, web page, or feature on the web applications and create a report showcasing your findings to the management.
Identify design problems and technical limitations from time to time and devise elegant solutions using the latest trends and techniques.
Be passionate about all things in user experience and other areas of design and innovation—research and showcase knowledge in the latest trends and technologies from time to time.
Requirements
A minimum of four years’ experience in UX designing using best practices and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design.
Expertise in standard UX software such as Zeplin, InVision, Balsamiq, Figma, and similar tools is necessary. Experience with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills is required.
Prior experience in developing a UX/UI framework for mid to large size organizations is a plus.
The candidate should have excellent knowledge of user-centered design (UCD) and design UX solutions to reduce maintenance costs and improve end-user’s productivity.
Communicate clearly and effectively on the design processes, ideas, and solutions to the development teams, business stakeholders, and product management teams.
Candidate should have hands-on experience in planning and conducting user research, usability testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, and identifying accessibility concerns.
Have an open mindset to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.

job_descriptions.475cff2a4b75721c:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJoin the hundreds of talented and innovative team members who are making an impact every day at California Times, incorporating Los Angeles Times and San Diego Union-Tribune, two of the most iconic media brands in the nation. Whether you love to tell compelling stories or want to drive our award-winning powerhouse in new directions, the Los Angeles Times team is the place to be.
Job Description Summary
The Los Angeles Times is looking for a multiplatform editor to help edit, write and produce our newsletters, which have become a vital platform for connecting our journalism with our audience.
Job Description
The Times currently has more than two dozen newsletters, including Essential California , Coronavirus Today , Dodgers Dugout and the Latinx Files .
We’re looking for an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial journalist who can edit and contribute to our expanding portfolio of newsletters as well as help write Today’s Headlines , one of our flagship newsletters.
If you join us, you will be part of the digital transformation of our newsroom and a reorientation of The Times around our most important mission: serving our readers.
You will also:
Work closely with journalists across departments and time zones to write, edit, schedule, produce and proofread newsletters
Help conceive new daily and weekly newsletters, as well as continually improve upon existing products
Track the newsletters’ performance and work with editors and writers to build audience and improve key performance indicators
Assist editors and writers in tracking and incorporating reader response and suggestions
Work with our newsletter product manager and UX designer on the reader experience
We’re looking for candidates who have:
Strong news judgment, writing and editing skills and attention to detail
Experience working diplomatically across newsroom disciplines and an inclusive approach in the workplace
Deep interest in online audiences, analytics and the best practices of editorial newsletters
Basic HTML skills
This editor will work primarily a night shift, which may include Sundays or holidays depending on demands.

This job is classified as Multiplatform Editor and is included in the Los Angeles Times Guild. Times staffers are currently working remotely, but when we return to the newsroom this position will be based in El Segundo, Calif.
The L.A. Times is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes expressions of interest from people with diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Explore our company history, achievement, values, mission and more on our Careers Site .
Qualified candidates should submit a resume, cover letter and applicable clips to Scott Sandell, newsletter editor.
Please note, the opportunity to attach additional documents appears on the third screen and is labeled “Upload.”
Thank you for your interest in joining our team at the Los Angeles Times! We look forward to reviewing your application.
job_descriptions.1f4136e7a3303543:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionTesla, Inc., headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, has one mission: Accelerate the world's transition to sustainable energy. To that end, we are building the world's best electric vehicles, most versatile charging network, biggest grid storage batteries in the world, and the most integrated roof-top solar solution. Our energy products include solar, battery storage, and vehicle charging. Their scale ranges from residential customers all the way to utilities, including off-grid and microgrid applications. The energy products team is rapidly growing and is adding highly qualified members to the product, engineering, finance, and sales teams.
Job Description
You’ll be part of the Product Management team within Tesla Energy. This team supports development and deployment of all Residential Energy Products across Tesla. We need a highly motivated UX Designer to join our team.
This role will provide direct support for applications used by customers, installers and service engineers of Powerwall, Solar, and Wall Connector. You will make key contributions to the development and rapid growth of these products and the entire Tesla Energy business. This will entail working directly with firmware and software engineering teams at Tesla HQ in Palo Alto, Tesla Design Studio in LA, and our users directly.
Responsibilities
Work with UI teams to adopt a cohesive design language across applications
Gather requirements of customers, installers, and service engineers when using our applications
Create insights and metrics of the current user experience to inform the software roadmap
Collaborate with Tesla Design Studio to create assets and components for applications
Prototype features for customer and installers to create an intuitive user experience
Develop useful A/B test variants and document results
Document test criteria and acceptance results
Create supporting content with user-centric copy to be used in applications and websites
Requirements
Degree in design or other technical foundation
A general understanding of energy concepts related to Solar, EV charging and Energy Storage
Experience in designing and prototyping applications using industry tools such as Figma, Sketch, the Adobe Suite, or others
Experience with user research, information architecture, wireframing and user testing for consumer products
Knowledge of Web (HTML/JS) or Mobile (iOS / Android) development
Exposure to 3D graphics tools & engines such as Blender, Maya, Godot, Unreal Engine is a huge plus
Excellent organization, communication, and documentation skills. Must have outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
A passion for renewable energy

job_descriptions.f6cbd4d254726f97:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionUI/UX Designer

Location: Berkeley, CA / Remote US. Full-time.

"The battery is the technology of our time." -The Economist

Voltaiq is an Enterprise Battery Intelligence software company. Our data platform brings unprecedented analytics, visualization, and predictive capabilities to any company with a battery-powered business model. World-leading brands — including global automakers in Detroit and Germany, household-name tech giants, and decacorn startups — depend on Voltaiq software to accelerate product development, optimize performance, ensure safety and reliability, and unlock financial value in their products. Our high-powered team is composed of battery industry veterans, PhD scientists, a highly skilled product and engineering team, and an advisory board of C-level industry execs, all of whom are passionate about enabling the global energy transition. Voltaiq is headquartered in Berkeley, CA, serving customers around the world.

The Role:

At Voltaiq, we enable battery researchers and applications engineers to explore and visualize battery performance data, alongside metadata describing how those batteries were made and operated. As a UI/UX Designer, you will work with the Product Manager to design the user-facing side of a web application offering powerful data search, processing, visualization, and advanced workflow functionality. You will learn how battery data is used to improve the performance of mobile devices, electric vehicles, and the power grid. You will design dashboards and other interfaces presenting performance statistics to our customers. If you love data visualization and delightful user experiences, and you are passionate about helping to accelerate the global transition to sustainable energy, then this is the job for you!

Responsibilities:

Design user experiences that are simple, coherent, and powerful.
Understand the evolving needs of our customers, and how these are served by the product.
Collaborate with Product Management, Customer Success and Engineering teams to assess effectiveness and feasibility of designs.
Test and validate designs with our user community through usability testing of wireframes, clickable prototypes and shipped product.
Help define and integrate a visual identity into the Voltaiq platform.
Maintain a cohesive set of UI/UX principles, strategies and patterns that extend across our platform.
Develop user personas through collaboration with Product Management.
Map out our users' conceptual model and design the site information architecture.
Find creative ways to solve UI/UX problems and display complex data visually.

Qualifications:

3+ years of experience in user-centered interface design for web applications.
Proficiency with visual design tools, such as Figma, Invision, and Adobe Creative Suite.
Experience with data visualization, including charting libraries such as D3, C3, and Plotly.
Experience designing interactions for enterprise workflows.
Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and Javascript.
Strong user empathy; ability to find creative solutions to UX problems and user pain points.
Strong teamwork and mentorship skills.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Comfortable with remote work and communicating effectively through real-time text, audio, or video chat.

Competitive salary plus equity and full benefits. Our office is located in Berkeley, CA.

Voltaiq is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to achieving a diverse workforce through application of its equal opportunity and nondiscrimination policy, in all aspects of employment.
job_descriptions.0f1302c1615acd2e:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionWe welcome applicants who are also open to working remote, except Colorado.
About E-Builder:
A Trimble Company: Founded in 1995 and based in Sunrise, Florida, e-Builder is an award-winning provider of cloud-based construction management software. The most prestigious organizations worldwide (Facebook, CalTech, etc.) use e-Builder to improve construction outcomes. As one of the fastest-growing companies in South Florida, we are proud to be named a ‘Florida Company to Watch,’ to be nominated as one of South Florida’s best places to work, and for our CEO to be named South Florida Business Journal’s Ultimate CEO. We’re excited to find innovative ways to combine technology with construction. Learn more about our award-winning organization and corporate culture at e-builder.net.
We are looking for a UX Designer responsible for:
Lead User Experience on cross-functional teams through UI solutions. Able to work independently and collaboratively.
Plan and conduct user research, interviews, co-creation sessions, and surveys, translating them into JTBD Canvases, user journeys, sitemaps, workflows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes optimized for native and web.
Collaborates with other UX team members designing the overall patterns, styles, and functionality of the product and iterates upon it to ensure a great user experience. Confident and able to articulate the use of different design elements and patterns. Understands and can convey the importance of following a standard brand style.
Take a Lean UX user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs. Confident to create prototypes quickly using high and low fidelity and knowing when either is appropriate.
Facilitate desired outcomes working with MVPs conceptualizing, visualizing, and communicating ideas throughout the lifecycle.
Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders, contributing to brainstorming discussions, user story mapping, contributing to writing user stories, BDDs, and estimations.
Uses research, analytics, and metrics to make informed design decisions. Has working knowledge using research methodologies and best practices for usability testing, surveys, analyzing data, and presenting data.
Identify design problems and create delightful solutions. Has working knowledge with interaction design and knowing when to use specific patterns. Has working experience with information architecture and understanding the users’ work domain.
Prepare digital assets for the development team, including icons, page layouts with consideration of contrast and other accessibility requirements.
Take smart risks and champion new ideas. Conducts themselves as UX advocates by listening and considering alternative views remaining approachable, and leading others. Able to persuade team advocating for the users. Confident to drive the group toward consensus.
Able to facilitate critiques as a UX Advocate. Raises the bar on discussion meetings and desired outcomes.
Qualifications
3+ years of UX design experience. Preference is given to candidates with experience designing complex B2B solutions for web, iOS, and Android. Experience with web design patterns and Accessibility compliance knowledge.
BA/BS degree in Design (e.g., interaction, graphic, visual communications, product, industrial), HCI, CS, or a related field or equivalent practical experience.
An understanding of the importance of user-centered design. A grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.
Experience in using UX design best practices to design solutions and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. Experience with Jobs-To-Be-Done a plus.
Demonstrated experience in crafting usable digital interfaces using UX software such as Adobe Suite, Sketch, In-Vision, and the like is a must. Basic understanding of HTML5, CSS3.
Ability to work with clients, both external and internal, to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
The candidate must demonstrate the ability to iterate through designs efficiently and intelligently.
Portfolio of works required.
Experience with Confluence and JIRA and/or in the construction industry a plus.
Personal Qualities
Be passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation. Keep abreast of the industry’s latest trends and technologies.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Including the ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
Excellent collaboration skills. Being willing to collaborate with teammates, share knowledge, and work effectively with them, and learn from them and bring an understanding of learning.
Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to deliver design solutions regularly.
Leads by example, always behaving professionally and working in the best interests of the company.
To learn more about our award-winning organization and corporate culture visit www.e-builder.net
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace
