job_descriptions.fb5aa8f8b303f616:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
6+ years of design experience
An available online portfolio

Note on Location: We are open to this role being located in Sunnyvale or other US corporate offices (including but not limited to New York, Boston, San Diego, Los Angeles, Nashville, Washington DC, and more).

Amazon strives to exceed the expectations of our customers by ensuring shipments are delivered quickly, safely, and as compliant as possible. Amazon’s Transportation Risk and Compliance Team (TRC) protects Amazon’s various transportation businesses by implementing scalable risk management solutions that foster continued business growth. To support the business, we build tools to manage the audit experience that are integrated with our transportation partners.

We are building a world class web/mobile audit platform, solving deep algorithmic problems, creating brand new tools that cater to multi-party business scenarios, and building data ingestion pipelines to internal and external systems. Our systems audit across a multitude of transportation segments and modes both within and across international borders. This mandates building highly available and scalable distributed systems.

You will:

Lead end-to-end UX/product design
Create user-centered designs by understanding business requirements, voice of the customer, user journeys, customer feedback, and usability findings.
Quickly and iteratively create user flows, wireframes, prototypes, high fidelity mockups and detailed UI and visual design specifications to Product and Engineering teams, as well as business stakeholders and executive leadership.
Incorporate customer feedback, technical constraints, and usability findings into design.
Develop and maintain detailed information architecture and design specifications.
Performing metrics analysis post-launch to inform design/UX optimization efforts.
Bachelor or Master's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent degree.
Fluent in English, with excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills including the ability to communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization
Proficiency designing and prototyping with tools such as Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, and/or InVision
Familiarity with the technical considerations needed when designing
Experience owning the UX design of complex workflows for projects of large scope and complexity.
Experience in best practices for information architecture and design, as well as strong knowledge of usability principles and techniques.
UI and visual design experience and knowledge of typography and color theory
Demonstrated history of acquiring user data (e.g., conducting usability studies, performing user research) and creating personas and journey maps.
Experience working in a collaborative, diverse team, working directly with developers for implementation of designs.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us
job_descriptions.08821c1d64d00977:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout SugarCRM, Inc.
SugarCRM is a customer experience (CX) leader enabling businesses to create profitable customer relationships by delivering highly relevant, personalized experiences throughout the customer journey. We empower companies to strengthen existing customer relationships, create new ones through actionable insights and intelligent automation and better understand the customer at every stage of the journey. This enables businesses to accelerate demand generation, grow revenue, deliver superior customer care and increase loyalty. Our easy-to-use, intuitive platform makes customer experience easy and accessible for everyone, allowing marketing, sales and services professionals to focus on high-impact, value-adding activities that create customers for life.
Come be a part of a team of designers passionate about creating the very best product for our users. As a Senior UX Designer, you will be involved in every aspect of the product development process, from brainstorming the next great product innovation to tweaking pixels right before launch. You will be expected to utilize your full range of designs, and you will own the experience for a wide area of the product.
Where do you fit:
You are smart, talented, and aspire to be a master of your craft: You are able to distill complex problems and propose simple, elegant solutions. You are confident enough to deliver unconventional insights and designs.
You play well with others: You thrive in a collaborative environment. You are as good at soliciting feedback on your own work as you are at adding value to others.
You are passionate about new technology: You follow the latest trends, download the newest apps, read the relevant design blogs. You have a keen eye for beautiful and useful products.
You are even more passionate about people: You never lose sight of what matters most to our customers. You are a tireless advocate for our end users and unwavering in your desire to provide the best experience.
Impact you will make in the role:
Design an easy-to-use, simple, beautiful product that also fulfills the high standards enterprise software must adhere to
Lead and participate in all phases of the design process (brainstorm to making to QA)
Conduct user research and usability testing, write up and present results
Work cross-functionally with product management, engineering and marketing
Give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise our bar for quality
Expertise you will bring in:
Knowledge of product strategy and vision
Experience in building and shipping applications
Experience in URL featuring examples of interaction design work
Demonstrated experience with end-to-end (hybrid UX and UI) design
4+ years of application design experience
4+ years of interaction design experience
Strong project management, communication, and presentation skills
Ability to prototype out your ideas (Axure, Invision, etc…) BA/BS or MA/MS in interaction design, HCI, industrial design, or related field or equivalent experience
Please provide a link to your portfolio when applying.
Bonus: Experience with the design of enterprise apps, tools design, productivity tools and user research
Location: Cupertino, CA; Raleigh-Durham, NC; Atlanta, GA; Orlando, FL; Denver, CO; Remote
We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we’re looking for. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

Benefits and Perks:
Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some great benefits and perks:
Excellent medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your family, along with other benefit plans including 401(k) matchUnlimited Paid Time OffWellness Reimbursement ProgramOnsite Programs, depending on location, such as Dry Cleaning, Car Washes, Massage, Yoga, and moreCareer & Personal Development Program – multi-platformRegular social events
- Ownership is the greatest self-identity at SugarCRM - you are making an immediate impact
- We are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your career

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAdvanced Systems Group, LLC (ASG) provides onsite managed services for a large tech video-sharing platform. We are seeking a technically-minded post production professional with a specialty in UX/UI design to join our team and sit onsite with our client in San Bruno, CA or Playa Vista, CA.
As the UX Designer, you will use existing Figma libraries and components to create product UI examples for marketing campaigns, localization, app store updates, etc.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Design or equivalent practical experience.
5-7 years of experience as a UX or Production Designer.
Figma experience required, especially working with libraries and components.
Ability to capture details accurately and consistently, and produce pixel-perfect assets.
Experience in representing and advocating for UX concepts, such as user-centric design, accessibility, internationalization, etc.
Experience implementing visual design systems across mobile, tablet, and desktop.
Portfolio highlighting multiple projects and your direct contributions.
Preferred qualifications:
Strong collaboration, communication, and presentation skills.
Experience applying established brand and product principles to new projects.
Excellent conceptual, problem-solving and analytical-thinking skills
Experience designing for televisions.
Experience collaborating with multidisciplinary UX and/or product teams (marketing, motion, interaction, UX research, engineering, content strategy).

job_descriptions.2bfd1c1e21eaf119: Job detailsSalary$75,000 - $95,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeTemporaryContractInternshipNumber of hires for this role1QualificationsJapanese (Required)English (Required)Bachelor's (Preferred)UX: 1 year (Preferred)Full Job DescriptionOur goal is to support people with healthcare technology so they can maintain their health and achieve their life goals.VisionRe-evolving therapeutics with softwareWe strive for the ideal of medical care, a world where all people can receive high-quality treatment without worry. By evolving treatment with the power of technology, we will solve the social issues surrounding healthcare and realize ideal medical care.MissionCreating new therapeutic effects through technologyWe develop evidence-based medical programs, “Digital Therapeutics (DTx),” for patients who suffer from conditions that conventional treatment methods with drugs or devices could not effectively solve. We aim to deliver the new treatment to as many patients as possible.BackgroundOur approach to reaching the goal is centered around Digital Therapeutics (DTx). DTx is a new field of medicine designed to approach the root cause of health conditions using mobile applications. Our method does so by modifying how users understand and think about their conditions (cognitive change) and by changing their lifestyle gradually (behavioral change) to treat the conditions.CureApp is the leading company in the DTx field in Japan with the first and only DTx regulatory and reimbursement approvals*. Our pipeline includes nicotine addiction, hypertension, NASH liver disease, alcoholism, cancer treatment, and respiratory/cardiovascular conditions. Therefore, you will be responsible to assess their requirements and create a plan to meet the requirements. This may include:Discuss with potential customers (healthcare providers, insurance companies) and potential partners (pharmaceutical companies) to outline product functional requirementsCollaborate with the engineering team to create a minimum viable product to obtain feedback from potential customers and partnersPerform interviews and adjust functional requirements based on their inputFinally, it is important to maintain good communication with our Japanese management and engineering team:Report to Japanese management to share and discuss updatesDiscuss with other members of the U.S. expansion team to co-develop product expansion strategiesSkills and QualificationsSpeaks Japanese at a Business/Idiomatic levelSpeaks English at an idiomatic levelCross-cultural experience and understanding of U.S. culture and lifestyle (3+ years living in the U.S. is ideal)Intermediate coding skill (preferably TypeScript and JavaScript)Product prototyping experienceExperience in UI design tools (Sketch, Adobe XD, Figma, etc.)UX design experienceUser assessment experienceQualitative and quantitative analysis for product testsExperience in questionnaire developmentExperience in Google AnalyticsKnowledge of the U.S. healthcare system and/or experience in the medical field is a plusJob Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary, InternshipPay: $75,000.00 - $95,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:UX: 1 year (Preferred)Language:Japanese (Required)English (Required)Contract Length:1 yearMore than 1 yearWork Location:Multiple locationsCompany's website:https://cureapp.co.jp/en/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/CureAppIncEn/Work Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings
job_descriptions.cdd48431b141b540:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe Role:


Tesla Design is looking for an outstanding User Experience Designer to design the future of lease experiences. The UX Designer will be responsible for researching, designing, innovating, and prototyping new user experiences that pave the way for the future of energy & vehicles in a way that has never been done before. Our digital experiences and the way consumers, businesses and municipalities transition to EVs and sustainable energy will be transformative.
The Digital Experience Team focuses on consumer experiences you see on the website and in the Tesla App. The candidate will collaborate with finance and lease business owners, product owners, other designers, content strategists, developers and project managers and will be a key contributor and originator in their own right.
Candidates should possess exceptional design skills, creative problem-solving, a great sense of aesthetics, as well as user-centered design principals. The applicant must have an affinity for minimal design, typography, and attention to the smallest of details. A strong ability to distill complex problems into simple, elegant solutions is key to success at Tesla. We are a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial spirit, so the majority of the work will be focused on innovating original and creative content and application, as well as final deliverables and solutions that work in the real world.
You will be working on the most advanced vehicle, insurance and energy solutions in existence both today and tomorrow.
Responsibilities

Research and define UX strategy for consumer segments and different customer types building upon and scaling Tesla offerings
Imagine, conceive of, manage, and drive lease and finance UX design projects from defining customer problems or opportunities to concept to implementation
Develop creative and innovative design solutions for lease and financing experiences that support multiple types of users in different types of roles with varying scope and objectives
Define and implement creative solutions that help improve comprehension and clarity of financing options and decisions
Constantly measure how designs are performing for target customers. Iterate and improve those experiences as needed. Influences team roadmaps to include experience improvements when the design or product is not performing or needs improvement.
Invest in building relationships and trust with stakeholders, peers and working groups. Build a strong network across Tesla, globally.
Determines best UX solutions based on customer feedback and business goals and helps to determine overall direction, identifying challenges and adapting as needed based on the context of the solution and customer.
Foster the defining and sharing of UX design patterns and standards, artifact reuse and consistency across team members. Contribute to the Tesla Design System finance and pricing design patterns.
Requirements

3+ years work experience advocating for, creating and building and world-class experiences for mobile, web, TV or other digital devices. Knowledge of global design best practices and working for international companies a plus.
An excellent portfolio showcasing UI/UX and visual design work with a strong design sensibility and articulate storytelling. Evidence of exceptional design ability is a must
Must be proficient and highly skilled in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch and other design tools
Ability to prototype in Keynote, Flinto, Principle or Sketch
Understanding of front-end web and mobile technologies such as CSS/HTML and general understanding of back end technologies that are required to build out experiences. Partnering well with technology is a must.
Ability to perform in a fast paced, high stress iterative design process under minimal supervision
Customer-focused, with experience using design research methods to uncover customer insights. Are able to take those insights and define the desired customer outcomes.
Evidence of solving large scale problems for customers. Ability to take complex concepts and simplify them for the customer in the form or elegant experiences.
Excellent command of user experience, design principles, problem-framing skills, and beautiful visual design skills
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Strong ability to communicate design concept ideas through sketches, prototypes and wireframes. Experienced and comfortable with presenting work to executives and large groups. Strong ability to communicate complicated concepts and bring clarity to stakeholders and team members.
Self-motivated, able to work independently but also collaborative and driven by group critique. Proven track record as an expert in design who can collaborate well with other functions.
Education
Bachelors or master’s degree in the study of design including one of the following; Design, Web Design, Interaction Design, UI/UX Design, Service Design, Information Architecture, HCI, Human Factors, or a portfolio that shows equivalent project experience.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
The Walt Disney Company's Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) is a new, global business segment for The Walt Disney Company with the mission of providing consumers around the world access to the content they want most, on the latest platforms, at a time of rapidly-evolving consumer habits. Combining the Company's direct-to-consumer streaming services – ESPN+, the Disney+ streaming service and its ownership stake in Hulu - alongside Disney's international media businesses, DMED aligns cutting-edge technology with world-class content and beloved brands to expand the Company's global footprint and deliver highly-personalized entertainment experiences to diverse consumers around the world.

As a consultative recruitment specialist, the Senior Recruiter will demonstrate recruiting best practices to support our world-class talent attraction efforts. Integrated with the support of a professional functional recruiting practice, this professional will be directly responsible for the full service recruitment support for Disney Advertising Sales. #disneyadsales

In alignment with our talent acquisition vision, day-day activities will entail project management, strategic talent acquisition development, and impeccable recruitment execution to achieve an effective service delivery model. Critical talent acquisition assignments will require the development and execution of precise individual recruitment plans, inclusive of:
Strategy sessions and plan development
Attraction & marketing, sourcing & networking strategies
Talent identification
Candidate engagement and experiential management
Selection, conversion, and onboarding
The ideal Senior Recruiter will guide clients through the recruiting process by consulting on the candidate profile, developing a sourcing strategy, attracting top talent, assessing candidates, and successfully managing the offer process with internal partners. The Senior Recruiter is responsible for maintaining a high level of transparency and communication in their actions and managing progress reports and actions in the ATS and other systems. Additional consulting activities may occur in support of specific client or overall initiatives.

Responsibilities:
Project manage day to day recruitment through the development and execution of full life cycle recruitment plans; ensuring the candidate, client, team, and recruiter experiences are met with exceptional service delivery.
Responsible for identifying, evaluating, and employing candidates for executive and other professional positions within the segment.
Identifies opportunities for building robust talent pipelining, talent community, and talent brokering strategies; leads and drives creative development and execution
Designs innovative recruitment strategies aligned to current or forecasted talent for specified roles, multiple needs, and/or opportunistic talent
Generate qualified candidate pools through passive and active sourcing.
Develops the search strategy, occasionally in partnership with a sourcer, including creating a target list of competitor companies, identifying names of passive candidates and anticipated time frame of the search.
Demonstrate ability to attract, influence and convert hard to find passive talent through key attraction and employment opportunities by understanding the Direct-to-Consumer and Walt Disney Company specific landscape, competitive demographics, and employment value proposition.
Routinely and consistently offers creative solutions based on high level of business acumen and industry knowledge
Adhere to recruitment ATS and CRM practices and processes by utilizing system for sourcing and tracking of candidates and activity
Meet established hiring targets, manage client relationships, and interact with hiring-managers to discuss specific requirements.
Drive facilitation of continuous improvement via measurement tools, scorecards, and recruitment analytics.
Use social media tools and marketing/branding techniques to engage both active and passive candidates.
Lead cross functional project teams, non-direct reports, through relationship building/influence
Consult with key partners to help inform organization design through external talent information
Basic Qualifications:
7+ years of prior recruiting experience preferably in an enterprise corporate recruiting and sourcing environment, with emphasis on difficult to fill disciplines.
Executive search experience with expertise working with a low talent supply in a high demand market
Deeply knowledgeable about the talent market place and is able to advise others on the industry
Ability to support and influence the client/search with a level of sophistication while exhibiting strategic search capabilities (Data based Storytelling, Talent Maps, Competitive Landscape, Industry Expertise, TA Marketing)
Diversity recruiting/sourcing experience with demonstrated ability to successfully influence diverse hires
Seen as an expert by leaders/peers through understanding of business operations, various functions, segments, and business strategies
Proven success creating original sourcing/recruiting strategies as well as have the ability to effectively communicate sourcing/recruiting plans to all levels of clients within the organization.
Strategic sourcing capabilities including research techniques
Demonstrated ability to leverage internal and external partnerships to attract and recruit talent.
Expertise using social media tools for attracting, marketing, engagement, networking, and sourcing.
Experience providing excellent service for clients and candidates throughout the recruiting process.
Ability to develop strong working relationships with leaders and peers within the organization both within and across geographical markets.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Kenexa or an equivalent ATS and CRM.
Successful search firm experience.
Required Education
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.

job_descriptions.ad8d65e52ddc4748: Job detailsSalary$30,000 - $60,000 a yearJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role2 to 4Full Job DescriptionCan You Manage Hiring For This Revolutionary Photography Education Company?You've finally found it...The perfect job to skyrocket your career in hiring.If that's what you've been looking for, then this job could literally change your life!But only if you keep reading.iPhone Photography School is the world's leading resource on iPhone photography. In fact, we're one of the most successful online education companies of any kind.To stay at the top, we need help with hiring the best people for our team. And that's why we're looking for a Hiring Specialist.7 Reasons To Join iPhone Photography School As A Hiring Specialist1. Develop A Highly Marketable Skill Set In HiringIf you know how to hire people, you’ll never be out of work. That's because every company in the world needs help with hiring. It's that simple.But most companies don't know how to hire well. We know this because we used to be one of those companies. We’ve made so many embarrassing hiring mistakes...Thankfully, we've learned from our mistakes. It took us 5 years and tens of thousands of job applications… But now we have one of the most efficient hiring machines in the world.If you want to become a hiring expert, there’s no better place to do it than with us.2. Help Brilliant People Find Their Dream JobsOne of the things you love the most about hiring is the people.Meeting and getting to know job applicants from all walks of life is incredibly exciting. And helping them with something as important as finding a job is truly rewarding.We’re always looking for brilliant people to join our team. And we can offer them something very few companies can. Many of our employees say they have found their dream jobs with us.Join us, and you'll be helping brilliant people find their dream jobs.3. Take Our Company To The Next LevelWe've been the subject of dozens of magazine articles, TV news segments, online videos and awards. People are fascinated by our success so far.But we're only getting started. We're about to take online education to a whole new level.Currently, our team is just 19 people. To achieve our ambitious goals we’ll need to hire many more. And these hires will make or break the future of our company.That means your work will be critical to the future of our company.4. Stay In Control Of Your ScheduleEvery job will occasionally have emergencies and important deadlines causing you to work long hours. That's normal. But it becomes a problem when long hours are the norm.That's not how we choose to work. We want (and even ask) our team members NOT to work long hours. That's because we're building our team for the long run.Join our team, and you’ll stay in charge of your schedule.5. Stability You Can Count OnMost startups have huge ambitions – but little or no revenue. If you've spent years of your life in an exciting new project that never really took off, you already know how frustrating it can be.Rather than burning investor money, iPhone Photography School has been highly profitable for years. We’ve never taken investor money. Our rapid growth has been funded by sales.You won’t have to worry about our company running out of money.6. Perks That Make A DifferenceTo get the best results, we have to offer the best possible work conditions.Things like a top-of-the-line laptop, automated solutions for repetitive tasks, and investing in your education make your work more valuable. So providing them is a no-brainer for us.We also want you to have a sense of belonging to our team. Even if you work remotely, you'll get to meet your coworkers in person at our regular team retreats.Whether it's rafting through the wilderness, sailing to a remote island, or participating in an ancient sauna ritual, you’ll remember these adventures for years to come.7. Join A Company You Truly Believe InMany people don't believe that their company creates a positive impact on the world.But our company is different. We help millions of people take better photos. And we make the most beautiful online courses in the world.Every week we receive hundreds of heartfelt thank-you notes (take a look! https://www.facebook.com/iPhonePS/reviews/) from our students saying we helped fill their lives with the joy of photography.Join us, and you'll work for a company you truly believe in.What Will You Do As A Hiring Specialist?We get more than a thousand job applications each month. This number will continue to grow.Your job will be to review these applications and decide whether we want to continue the hiring process with each candidate. You’ll also interview the successful candidates.Over time, we'll be happy for you to take on more responsibilities in hiring. The more steps of the hiring process you can handle independently, the better it is for the company.Here’s What We Expect From YouWe can trust your decisions in the hiring processYou can carry out professional job interviews independentlyYou have the patience to go through hundreds of job applications per dayYou can “sell” our company to job applicantsYou have an eye for what makes a photograph or a video clip visually appealing (you’ll often have to evaluate applications for visual jobs such as video editor)This is a full-time position. You can do this job from anywhere in the world – including your home, our beautiful office in Riga, Latvia, or any paradise location.Please note that our hiring process includes a paid trial period if you advance to the next stage.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $30,000.00 - $60,000.00 per yearBenefits:Flexible schedulePaid time offSchedule:Monday to FridayWork Location:Fully RemoteCompany's website:https://iphonephotographyschool.com/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/iPhonePS/Work Remotely:Yes

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job Description
3+ years of corporate and/or agency in design recruiting including experience including sourcing recruiting
Experiencing with boolean search strings and best practices related to identifying passive talent in UI/UX design
Experience building and driving talent sourcing initiatives.
Experience working with recruiting and people-related tools and systems, including applicant tracking systems, resume databases, internet sourcing tools and complex spreadsheets

We’re seeking a Design Recruiter to join the dynamic recruiting team supporting Amazon Media (Amazon Music, IMDb, IMDb TV, and Amazon Live).

Imagine being a part of an agile team where your ideas have the potential to reach millions. Picture working on cutting-edge consumer-facing products, where every single team member is a critical voice in the decision-making process. Envision being able to leverage the resources of a Fortune-500 company within the atmosphere of a start-up.

The Design Recruiter will focus in the areas of candidate talent search and engagement, as well as talent acquisition process improvement and strategy development. They will foster a collaborative team environment and a strong service-oriented culture, which ensures delivery of an efficient, effective, quality driven service to internal customers to meet customer service level agreements.

The candidate must be able to successfully manage talent searches on a timeline and have experience setting benchmarks and metrics, as well as understand how to prioritize in a fast-paced environment, with tight deadlines. The successful individual thrives in an innovative, fast-paced environment, can roll up their sleeves, work hard, have fun, and get the job done.

The best candidates will draw on extensive knowledge of talent acquisition and will forge dynamic relationships with business leaders, hiring managers, and HR business partners. They will have a reputation for being exceptional at candidate generation, as well as possess deep negotiation, organization, verbal, and written communication skills. In addition, the successful candidate will have an ability to prioritize their time, demonstrate push-back and a sense of urgency, and understand the value of providing amazing customer service.

This is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to broaden their Recruiting/HR experience in a large-scale and high-performance recruiting organization. Our team culture is goal-oriented, fast paced, and fun! We are motivated by the challenge (and success) of hiring top talent for the ever expanding digital entertainment business.


Bachelors Degree
Client focused and committed to continuous improvement; ability to proactively network and establish effective working relationships, must pursue conscious cost-containment efforts in recruiting, continually seek new sourcing options, and develop creative approaches to delivering candidates to the customer.
Solid communication skills, organizational and negotiation skills, with a keen focus on delivering business results.
Ability to execute recruiting strategy, including employer promotion in the marketplace, candidate management, diversity sourcing, and interview process management.
Self-sufficient and able to work with little direct supervision.
Solid consulting skills and demonstrated ability to work in a team environment, as a team leader and member.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. .
job_descriptions.d9686f4e657d1eee:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
The Enterprise Talent Acquisition team is responsible for overseeing functional recruitment for Disney’s domestic business segments including Media Networks, Parks, Experiences & Products, The Walt Disney Studios, Direct-to-Consumer & International and Corporate. The group brings the expertise of attracting and identifying the highest performing talent in the marketplace while exceeding the expectations of our clients and advising clients on the best candidate talent match for their organization.

As a Senior Recruiter (PH) supporting Human Resources, you will be expected to demonstrate recruiting best practices to support our world-class talent acquisition efforts. In alignment with our talent acquisition vision, day-day activities will entail strategic staffing development, and impeccable recruitment execution to achieve an effective service delivery model. If you're passionate about acquiring top talent in the competitive landscape of interactive entertainment, we'd love to hear from you.

Responsibilities:
Develop strategies to source, attract, recruit and select high-quality candidates against defined criteria for multiple disciplines, primarily Controllership & Finance
Collaborate with Hiring Managers and HR Partners to develop a strong understanding of the department culture, business strategy and talent profiles to deliver on the hiring needs of the business
Conduct in-depth screens and assess potential candidates for level of interest, qualifications and compensation requirements
Use innovative sourcing channels to convert hard to find passive talent including social media, resume mining, diversity resources and networking
Drive and manage the candidate experience throughout the selection process including offer negotiation and new hire on-boarding
Effectively coach hiring managers in recruitment and selection processes while ensuring compliance with employment laws
Partner with compensation and hiring managers to determine and define attractive and competitive job offers
Establish and build relationships with other Disney recruiters to share knowledge, HR trends, and experiences to execute best practices enterprise-wide
Continuously develop business knowledge of company and departmental objectives, industry and key corporate challenges, and current market dynamics
Accurately track and report recruitment activity data to support staffing metrics
Develop a broad professional network of top talent and build deep pipelines
Basic Qualifications:
A minimum of 5 years recruiting experience; previous experience developing and executing fully comprehensive sourcing/recruitment plans
Demonstrated experience with Applicant Tracking Systems
Experience working a fast-paced environment where multiple projects are the norm
Ability to work effectively in a team environment and communicate effectively across multiple departments and levels
Experience using social media tools for sourcing efforts including but not limited to LinkedIn Recruiter, Twitter, Facebook, blogs etc.
Proven ability to support/interact with senior-level management
Strong negotiation and presentation skills and outstanding attention to detail
Excellent consultative skills and proven success developing strong relationships with hiring managers, cross-functional partners and key stakeholders
Ability to maintain confidential information
Advanced knowledge of federal, state, and local employment laws
Ability to work as a team player
Microsoft Office Suite
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with multiple Disney lines of business a plus
Experience with Kenexa or other similar Applicant Tracking System
Experience utilizing SAP or Workday
Required Education
Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience

job_descriptions.b621e184c1858819:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCompany Description

Twitter is what’s happening and what people are talking about right now. For us, life’s not about a job, it’s about a purpose. We believe real change starts with conversation. Here, your voice matters. Come as you are and together we’ll do what’s right (not what’s easy) to serve the public conversation.
We are looking for someone to help scale our new hire orientation program and partner with our onboarding team to support global delivery. You are focused on execution of strategy, and do it well with limited guidance and direction - you figure things out and have a strong reputation for getting things done.

Why it matters:
We are committed to enabling anyone, anywhere to grow and have an impact. This role is key to serving a global audience with the learning that they need, in a format that they can consume.

Job Description

Collaborate with the onboarding team to deliver orientation and eLearning for new employees; provide coordination and logistics support for live programs, ensuring a high-quality experience for participants and facilitators.
Support the new hire orientation program manager in providing an impactful onboarding experience to all new hires.
Work closely with key stakeholders to ensure accuracy and alignment of programs, collateral, and communications.
Manage tasks associated with our Learning Management System (LMS) including: managing course enrollment; tracking and reporting learning activities; managing facilitators; collecting and analyzing participant feedback.
Address help-desk questions and triage requests related to onboarding.

Qualifications

You’re an owner - a productivity expert, driven, focused, and able to work independently as well as in a team environment
Superior customer service orientation with strong follow-up skills (verbal and written).
Detail-oriented, with strong organizational, and time management skills.
Demonstrated ability to assess data, identify actionable insights, and present findings.
Familiarity with virtual training and meeting tools and an aptitude in working with new technology or systems.
Experience collaborating effectively with a team and other internal and external stakeholders.
Ability to create and iterate quickly and continuously improve (both the customer experience as well as tools/processes).

A few other things we value:
Challenge - We solve hard problems. Come to be challenged, learn, and thrive.
Proactive - We continuously focus on improving and increasing our impact and use data to help us measure our success.
Diversity - Diversity makes us a better organization and team. We value diverse backgrounds, ideas, and experiences.
Work, Life, Balance - We work hard, but we believe with hard work should come balance.
Additional Information

We are committed to an inclusive and diverse Twitter. Twitter is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status.
San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeContractFull Job DescriptionTo get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Recruiting
Job Details
What you’ll be doing…
Tableau is looking for someone to join our recruiting team as a Recruiting Coordinator! The Recruiting Coordinator plays an important role in the hiring process by partnering closely with our recruiting team and hiring managers, and interacting in a positive and engaging way with our candidates.
Some of the things you’ll be doing include …
Scheduling and coordinating phone screens and interview loops, working directly with the candidates and hiring teams to ensure that the interview experience is both positive and enjoyable for all.
Initiating and tracking candidate background checks.
Preparing offer letters and other on-boarding documents.
Maintaining our Applicant Tracking System to ensure accurate data, workflow status, etc.
Assisting in the creation of job descriptions and posting jobs to the company website and job boards.
Coordinating travel arrangements for remote candidates and processing expense reimbursements.
Working collaboratively with recruiters to maintain accuracy and data integrity.
Assisting with other recruiting activities as needed
Who you are…
Experienced. You have prior administrative support experience, preferably for a Recruiting / HR department. You have mad scheduling skills...particularly when juggling multiple busy calendars.
Excellent Communicator. You have exceptional communication skills, both oral and written. You are able to effectively communicate with a wide variety of audiences and all levels of an organization. You also maintain strict confidentiality as required.
Detail-oriented. You have unmatched documentation and organizational skills, and you excel at prioritizing when given multiple projects. Your attention to detail is second to none.
Problem-Solver. You love tackling the most difficult challenges and know how to get to the best solution.
Fast-paced. You thrive in a fast- paced environment and know exactly how to prioritize when balancing many different projects and timelines. You are results driven and always operate with a sense of urgency.
Technical. You are proficient with MSFT Office Suite and Google Apps. Experience working with an applicant tracking system is preferred.
Team player. You have a positive attitude and work well as part of a team. You have a passion for creating and sustaining a positive company culture and contributing to Tableau's reputation and success.
You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
The Research Associate is an important part of the Executive Search and Talent Acquisition process. The primary focus of this role is supporting executive searches with research, candidate name generation, and data / marketplace visualization. The Research Associate will help to update industry and market research, turning relevant deliverables into reusable templates. The successful Associate will do this while handling multiple projects with competing deadlines, working with individuals who have differing styles, and managing challenging expectations.

This is a project hire with no guarantee of permanent placement. The current forecast is that the project work will last approximately 6-8 months.

Responsibilities:
Market and Candidate Knowledge:
Obtains and incorporates knowledge to enhance executive search work in a meaningful way. Knows how to get information and effectively uses the available resources, developing and sharing marketplace knowledge
Updating industry information, analyzing market trends and tracking “People Moves”; identifies executive movements in the market and updates database (ideally in real time) and colleagues
Has a genuine interest in/curiosity about people in the entertainment businesses
Maintains an understanding of film and television executives and their interrelationships; asks questions and shows interest in networking
Understands how to identify and navigate the various relevant sources available (Studio System, LinkedIn, IMBD, etc.)
Project Management:
Prepares media company mapping and overviews including all major television and film studios, production companies and streaming platforms (researching companies and developing target candidate lists)
Creates customizable company and talent mapping templates, including organization structures, for use throughout the executive search process
Observes and asks questions to fully understand the landscape; synthesizes information from a variety of internal/external sources, despite possibly having ambiguous or incomplete information
Gathers relevant data from a variety of sources to help determine broad capabilities, gaps, and qualifications; develops appropriate candidate “target” lists
Partners on “proprietary” market intelligence projects; proactively identifies and tracks organizational, industry, and/or functional trends and reports findings
Works on multiple projects; meets deadlines and is resilient under pressure; delivers on commitments on time
Basic Qualifications:
Passion for entertainment industry
BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Self-motivation and excellent time management skills
Demonstrated analytical, reporting and visualization skills with the ability to analyze, interpret, and visualize data utilizing database tools including TRM system and Excel
Quality-focused and ability to drive continuous improvement (plans, manages and drives own efforts with support from leaders); strong work ethic
Demonstrates enthusiasm, tenacity and intellectual curiosity; action-oriented; deals with problems immediately
Creative and innovative approach to problem solving
Client-service orientation; highly collaborative and team-oriented; flexible and agile
Understands the search process; asks questions to understand and is proactive in finding talent solutions
Required Education
BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience

As a Recruiter, you understand how to partner effectively with hiring teams by building creative sourcing strategies with a successful track record of converting passive leads into active candidates and hires. You are committed to delivering a consistent and positive experience for candidates and internal stakeholders. At Alteryx, you’ll be part of a collaborative team that celebrates wins, values inclusion, and delivers on its promise.
What You’ll Do:
Manage the full cycle recruiting process for customer success positions including sourcing, screening, interviewing, selection, negotiating, and closing candidates
Serve as a recruiting business partner and advisor to hiring managers and business leaders on market trends and activity
Develop creative sourcing strategies to attract passive candidates and create an ongoing passive pipeline of talent
Manage the content of the Applicant Tracking System (ATS) for assigned positions

Maintain the highest level of confidentiality and integrity when working with our candidates and hiring partners

3+ years full-cycle recruiting experience in the technology industry for go to market functions
Data-driven approach to optimize the hiring funnel
Experience building a diverse candidate pipeline, knowledge of Diversity & Inclusion recruiting best practices
Experience recruiting/sourcing in a fast-paced environment for a variety of sales roles
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with a customer-service focus and tenacious appetite for uncovering talent
Find yourself checking a lot of these boxes but doubting whether you should apply? At Alteryx, we support a growth mindset for our associates through all stages of their careers. If you meet some of the requirements and you share our values, we encourage you to apply. As part of our ongoing commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace, we’re invested in building teams with a wide variety of backgrounds, identities, and experiences.

This position is also remote-friendly and, as such, compensation will ultimately be in line with the location in which the position is filled. Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as a candidate’s relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionHelp us creatively source top technical talent for high-impact roles. Partner with hiring managers to build and improve recruiting processes and develop sourcing strategies for each of your roles, and guide our recruiters. Be the main connection for your candidates from source to close. Ensure a positive end-to-end interview experience for all candidates. Equally prioritize speed and care when responding to candidates. Represent Fathom and engage with candidates at conferences and events.
You’re probably a good fit for this role if you...
Are enthusiastic about technology and artificial intelligence, and their potential for positive impact.
Have a background in one of our technical areas or adjacent technical background.
Are passionate about initiating, building and cultivating relationships.
Have an entrepreneurial mindset, enjoy taking on challenging goals, and inventing clever paths to achieve them.
Key Responsibilities:
Help bring great people to Fathom. 30+ people this year.
Handle the full recruiting pipeline: from outreach, job ads, building and gathering info from team members to creating job requirements and interview questions all the way to helping get offers out.
Maintain several candidate pipelines and invent and manage a process to make sure every candidate has a good experience, even if we don't end up moving forward with them.
Partner with hiring managers to build and improve recruiting processes and develop sourcing strategies for each of your roles.
Help craft messages to a variety of audiences, communicate technology advantages lucidly, teach new concepts when necessary. This is a complex project combining deep optics, electronics, and-well deep learning.
Conduct strong technical sourcing (this means you understand the roles beyond keyword searches and understand the function and can help the team create accurate descriptions for future roles)
Conduct interviews using various reliable recruiting and selection tools/methods to filter candidates within schedule. First pass screen of applicants’ relevant knowledge, hard skills, soft skills, experience, and aptitudes.
The role:
Work from home or come into the office (after COVID), your choice
The jobs you’re hiring for are mostly based in the SF Bay Area, though some can be remote
You are the main connection for candidates from source to close
Competitive compensation and health benefits
Agility of a startup with the secure backing of a larger company and aligned investors
job_descriptions.82282c57c5b63f66: Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role2QualificationsBachelor's (Required)Recruiting: 1 year (Required)Full Job DescriptionORGANIZATIONThe Center for Autism and Related Disorders (CARD), LLC, is among the world’s largest and most experienced organizations effectively treating individuals with autism and related disorders. With US and international reach, CARD touches the lives of thousands of people affected by autism and their families. Through a network of trained therapists, supervisors, and researchers, we develop and implement quality, comprehensive, and personalized treatment programs that produce measurable results for every patient.CARD has designed a unique treatment curriculum using the principles and procedures of applied behavior analysis (ABA) and built a global organization of dedicated and highly trained staff. Currently, CARD has over 250 centers across the U.S. and affiliate sites across the globe.Department: RecruitingSupervisor: Recruiting ManagerExemption: Non-Exempt or ExemptDESCRIPTIONThe Recruiter will play an important part in the recruitment process. They will work closely with CARD’s recruiters and provide them with major support services. The Recruiter will spend a large portion of their time conducting internet research, creating and maintaining therapist job postings on various job boards, sourcing for therapist candidates and scheduling phone interviews for CARD recruiters. Modes of sourcing include, but are not limited to the following: Indeed, LinkedIn, Better Team, Handshake, and Facebook. The Recruiter will also make contact with community venues and local colleges to set up recruiting-related events. The Recruiter will also use social media as a means to recruit therapist candidates. Due to the sensitivity of the department, the Recruiter must be able to maintain a high level of confidentiality.RESPONSIBILITIESImplement and represent CARD policyRepresent CARD professionally and ethically to internal and external stakeholdersResearch and recommend new sources for active and passive candidate recruitingHandle classified advertising and utilize the Internet for recruitmentUse social and professional networking sites to identify and source candidatesHelp with college recruiting initiativesSchedule phone interviewsSource suitable candidates through various sourcing channelsSubmit weekly activity reports to recruiting supervisorConsistently meet weekly and monthly goalsActively participate in weekly recruiting meetings with assigned CARD location personnel and recruitersQUALIFICATIONSHigh school Diploma required, bachelor’s degree preferred1-2 years of recruiting experienceExcellent inter-personal relationship skills and ability to work with individuals of all levelsGood time management skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAbility to multi-task and handle large phone correspondencesDetail-oriented, organized and have the ability to work independently and as part of a teamKnowledge of all computer applications, such as: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and OutlookAbility to make cold calls and source talent at all levels of the organization.Must be a confident self-starter who can develop effective business relationships, both internally & externally.Work from home positionJob Type: Full-timeEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Recruiting: 1 year (Required)
job_descriptions.8a9d27b3af966025:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeInternshipFull Job DescriptionAtlassian is continuing to hire with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new and existing Atlassians will continue to work from home until it’s safe to return to our offices. When our offices re-open, we will provide the choice to work from home or return to work in an office unless a job requirement makes it necessary for a particular role to be performed at an Atlassian office.
We’re growing faster than ever and are on the lookout for a Senior Campus Recruiter to join our award-winning global Campus Recruiting team, based out of the Bay Area.
This is an exciting time to join the campus recruitment team in a period of hyper-growth. Our US campus program has scaled from a small number of campus hires to now well over 100 per season over the past 3 years. You can expect to be exposed to a lot of opportunities within an agile, collaborative, and lively environment.
Do you love getting creative about building programs from scratch? Do you find joy in identifying high potential early career talent? Do you flourish when it comes to guiding hiring partners and advising the business? If so, then this is the role for you!
You'll be responsible for all parts of the campus recruiting lifecycle, including scaling our current programs, driving a robust and diverse group of candidates, spreading the Atlassian brand and working closely with the greater talent team. You will learn and help advise on the intricacies of many business areas - including Engineering, Design, Product Management and Marketing as well as be a trusted partner with leaders across the business.
At Atlassian, you'll have the freedom to develop new initiatives and roll out new programs internally. This role is perfect for you if you're someone who loves to create and implement talent strategies, push boundaries and run with new and improved methodologies.
We are hiring for both Bay Area office locations, Mountain View and San Francisco.
On your first day, we'll expect you to:
Have exposure to building a highly regarded campus program
Experience scaling a recruitment pipeline and program
Have demonstrable experience mentoring team members or leading projects
Have a background in a full cycle high volume campus and early career recruitment
Work well on a team – willing to roll up your sleeves and be excited to contribute to all aspects of the intern and grad experience
Utilize data and metrics to analyze recruiting processes, predict future performance, and use resources effectively
Manage and develop relationships globally
Develop detailed recruiting plans for intern and full time hires through clearly defined objective, outcomes and sourcing strategies
Collaborate with key partners and early talent hiring managers to develop and drive recruiting strategies and results
Have an eye for detail with strong organizational and planning skills
Have 5+ years of experience in the recruiting space
It's great, but not required if you are:
Familiar with our relevant tools and programs (e.g Lever and university job boards)
Comfortable acting as the face of Atlassian, showcasing our values and opportunities to external candidates as well as internal contacts for our CTO and internal business partners
More about our benefits
Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more.
More about Atlassian
Creating software that empowers everyone from small startups to the who’s who of tech is why we’re here. We build tools like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello to help teams across the world become more nimble, creative, and aligned—collaboration is the heart of every product we dream of at Atlassian. From Amsterdam and Austin, to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who want to write the future and who believe that we can accomplish so much more together than apart. At Atlassian, we’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to: Unleash the potential of every team.
Additional Information
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians is the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Learn more about Atlassian’s culture, interviewing flow, and hiring process by checking out our Candidate Resource Hub.
job_descriptions.c350aa8572322e25:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCoalition Technologies is devoted to doing the highest quality of work for our clients while maintaining a fun, thriving environment for our team. Along with the opportunity to grow with our team, we are excited to offer:

The most competitive profit-sharing bonus plans in the industry. We pay up to 50% of all profits monthly to all full-time employees!
Joining our Coalition means you also get to enjoy paid time off and subsidized gym memberships.
Living in LA? Flex days, free Friday lunches, regular company events, and higher base salaries are all extra benefits that our in-office team members enjoy.
Our US-Based team members can enjoy our medical, dental, vision, and life insurance packages in all US states.
Our international team members have the opportunity to participate in our International Insurance Reimbursement Program, a benefit unique to Coalition.

100% of our team works remotely with the support of time tracking software. Our company culture has specialized in supporting remote team members for over a decade. We welcome your application, wherever in the world it's coming from!

YOU SHOULD HAVE:
Prior experience with recruitment, sourcing, screening, hiring etc. International recruiting experience is a plus
Passion for recruitment and human resources
Great interpersonal, analytical, problem solving, negotiating, influencing, facilitation, decision-making, and conflict resolution skills
The ability to stay highly organized with great attention to detail
The ability to maintain strict confidentiality and discretion
Excellent written and spoken English
The availability to work 40 hours per week from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm PST
Passion to build a startup
An outgoing and friendly disposition
Reliable transportation if working in-house
A reliable workstation with a fast computer, microphone and speakers, reliable internet and power if working remotely
YOUR DUTIES AND TASKS:
Drafting and posting job ads
Reviewing resumes and screening candidates
Scheduling interviews and skills tests by coordinating appointments
Conducting interviews with candidates either in person, over the phone, or through Skype
Administering skills tests
Inputting, updating and maintaining data in the recruiting database
Conducting exit interviews in the event that an employee leaves the company
Assisting management with personnel issues and employee development
Assisting management with organizing and coordinating employee training workshops
Planning and executing company events
Protecting operations by keeping human resource information confidential
Providing horizontal support to other staff members of the recruitment team
Remote/Telecommuting optional. No education or experience required for candidates who excel in our skills tests.
job_descriptions.524c173ce2615e3c:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timePart-timeFull Job DescriptionWant to join a team of movers and shakers that just took home 13 major awards, including being one of Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies and the Marketing Agency of the Year by Best in Biz, AND holds the record for most successful TikTok campaign of all time? Ninety BILLION views (and counting) and a lot of press coverage later, brands are clamoring to work with us. So we're looking for your help.

Movers+Shakers is a niche creative studio, specialized in spreading joy through digital disruption. We leverage the power of original music and movement to connect brands to culture and drive deep emotional engagement. Our clients include Warner Bros, e.l.f. Cosmetics, Bliss, DSW, Amazon, and Match.com. Our digital-first campaigns stop the scroll. Are you on TikTok? You may have seen or participated in one of our TikTok campaigns.

Join our rocketship and let's go out and spread more joy!

THE ROLE

As the third member of the M+S recruiting team, you are an expert in the Creative agency world and understand all things social media, creative, production, client success and design. You will be responsible for sourcing passive creative talent and partnering with hiring managers and the recruiting team to grow the organization. This role will be 80% sourcing creative talent and 20% scheduling and project management. This role is freelance part time or full time, starting in April/May.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Creatively source and pipeline talent through LinkedIn Recruiter and other platforms
Craft creative messaging to attract both active and passive talent
Screen applicants when necessary and schedule interviews for hiring team members
Constantly track and maintain data in Greenhouse ATS
Partner with Recruiting Manager to create recruiting and sourcing tools, streamline/build recruiting/sourcing processes and develop structured interview processes
Ensure an amazing candidate experience through thoughtful communication, timely feedback, interview preparation and interview preparedness for hiring teams
Build and maintain excellent relationships with hiring managers to understand hiring needs
Help define and implement creative sourcing at M+S

QUALIFICATIONS

1-5 years of experience sourcing passive Creative talent for agencies and brands
Must have creative sourcing & recruiting experience!
Experience using LinkedIn Recruiter
Proficiency in Greenhouse, Google Suite, Slack
Ability to thrive in a VERY fast paced environment with little structure
Amazing communication skills, personable demeanor, multitasker, creative mindset and ability to be scrappy
Ideally has a network of creative talent
We look forward to hearing from you!
job_descriptions.c67287b7448500cb:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionOur mission at Jobscan is to empower job seekers and help them land more interviews. We analyze resumes and LinkedIn profiles against job descriptions, helping our users stand out against the competition. Our users love us - we’re completely user-funded, profitable, and growing exponentially.
We are looking for a collaborative Technical Recruiter that will own the recruiting process from sourcing and screening candidates, to interviewing candidates onsite, and extending and negotiating job offers. The ideal candidate will combine their ability to drive the recruiting process with a willingness to learn and take on new challenges. You’ll be working closely with all hiring managers within a start - up environment to help scale and grow the company.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Take ownership of the full life-cycle recruiting process for a variety of technical and business roles across all functional groups
Proactively source active and passive candidates through direct sourcing, employee referrals, networking, internet and social media recruiting, internal databases and innovative research tactics
Recruit and evaluate highly skilled talent within a competitive recruiting market
Develop strong relationships with hiring managers to understand strategic objectives along with providing solutions and recommendations to hiring needs while creating structure and rigor around candidate experience
Manage the interview and recruiting process; schedule phones screens, on-site interviews and follow-up appropriately
Manage relationships and recruiting process with 3rd party recruitment agencies
Partner with hiring managers to develop job descriptions, a sourcing strategy and how to sell to passive candidates
Provide consulting to hiring managers on hiring best practices
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
Agency experience required
2-3+ years experience in sourcing and closing both non-technical and technical talent in a competitive market
Innate competitive drive to source and attract top tech talent of varying experience levels and backgrounds
Demonstrated ability to manage recruitment activities for various levels and use innovative methods to source and attract passive candidates
Strong professional demeanor using good judgement, maturity, and the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion
Passion for recruiting and demonstrating curiosity to stay abreast of current trends and best practices
What’d Be Cool To Have:
Knowledge of the start-up and technology space is preferred
Lever ATS and Rippling experience is a plus
Our Benefits & Perks Include:
Competitive salary + stock options, flexible schedule, flexible PTO, 401(k) + match, medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, full office closure last week of the year. Education. internet, and remote technology stipend. As we continue to grow, we are always adding more benefits and perks for our team.

At this time, we are only considering candidates who are authorized to work in the United States without employer sponsorship.
Jobscan provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

We work with the latest and greatest global tech startups, from early-stage up-and-comers to $2B+ unicorns. Currently, we are looking to add an experienced Recruiter to our team to effectively construct the working communities of these businesses.As a Recruiter, you will help grow and sustain our company by encouraging impact. That is, you will be impacting our clients, our prospective candidates, our team, and your own career. This role is for an experienced recruiter looking to increase their industry knowledge and elevate their recruiting skills to the next level.Responsibilities: Manage the full-cycle recruiting process from initial sourcing all the way through to offer negotiation and acceptance.· Research our clients’ industries and needs to cultivate understanding of their ecosystems· Identify potential candidates through various sources (social media, databases, referrals…)· Creatively build applicant outreach messages that accurately/uniquely reflect opportunities· Engage in sparking conversation with prospects to present company opportunities· Submit qualified candidates to clients’ hiring managers in a compelling manner· Support candidates, ensuring a positive candidate experience through entire hiring process· Build a strong, professional working network with companies and candidatesDesired Experience: · At least 1-2 years experience as a full-lifecycle recruiter or in a relevant HR/Talent related role· Proven computer abilities, especially within Microsoft Office and Google Drive· Clear and professional verbal/written communication skills· Ability to work autonomously within a goal-oriented environment· Energetic with a positive attitude and ability to perform in a dynamic environment· Mastery of organizational, prioritization, and multi-tasking skills are crucial for success· Bachelor’s DegreeConnect with us as we embark on a journey together to help build the best companies in the world!Job Type: Full-timePay: $54,000.00 - $90,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingFlexible scheduleHealth insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridaySupplemental Pay:Commission payEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Recruiting: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationCommunication method(s) used:EmailPhoneThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsAutonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little directionCompany's website:www.link2usa.ioBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:YesCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processVirtual meetings
