job_descriptions.8e06dd5362a7b18f:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionEstablished in 1973, Cacique® has affirmed itself as America's leader in Hispanic perishables. Our product offerings span from fresh cheeses, table creams, and processed cheese to cured meats and drinkable yogurts. Our company has a leadership position amongst the Hispanic population nationwide and enjoys a steady path of growth. We are a very dedicated and competitive family owned company which offers an excellent environment in which to thrive and grow.


Cacique looks to hire future teammates who embody Cacique's Four Pillars: Family, Quality, Integrity and Authenticity. These four Pillars are the values that have been the foundation of Cacique's success since its inception in 1973. Our work culture embraces people who are innovative, resourceful, determined, catalysts of change and champions of our values.


We are currently looking for a passionate Human Resources professional to become our next Corporate Recruiter on our Human Resources Team. Cacique is experiencing rapid growth and is looking for an experienced, motivated recruiter to help us. The Corporate Recruiter will embody a process improvement mindset, ability to multitask and service internal customers and potential new teammates with a world class experience. The Corporate Recruiter will serve as the gatekeeper in ensuring that we attract and retain the right talent that will help the Organization reach their long term business goals. The Corporate Recruiter will be responsible for full-cycle recruiting including workforce planning / needs analysis, sourcing, screening, through the offer process.


This position may be based at any Cacique facility or as remote work-from-home.


Corporate Recruiter Responsibilities


Develop and own the overall recruiting strategy for Cacique
Use traditional and non-traditional methods (databases, social media, etc) to source and recruit potential candidates
Maintain and improve our ATS platform - Review resumes and analyze them
Manage content and relationships with 3rd party recruiting sites (such as LinkedIn, CareerBuilder, Indeed, etc.) and with external headhunters and staffing agencies.
Create digital and printed recruitment materials
Post jobs to the appropriate places - job boards, newspapers, community services, employment agencies, and colleges
Establish and maintain relationships with universities, local trade schools, and other potential sources of new teammates
Interview potential staff, using reliable recruiting tools and selection methods
Assess potential applicants for their relevant knowledge, experience, training, skills, aptitudes, and soft skills
Onboard new staff by introducing them to the company and guiding them through hiring and training
Manage the new teammate relocation process when if necessary
Partner with HR team to develop job descriptions as well as job specifications, and ensure they are kept updated
Provide recruiting reports on key metrics
Build and maintain relationships with candidates during screening process
Recommend any new policies or procedures that may benefit our company

Required Skills

Familiar with HRIS (ADP preferred), ATS (Silkroad preferred), and Candidate Management Systems
Excellent communication skills
Strong decision-making skills
Good negotiation skills

Required Experience

At least 5 years of HR / Recruiting experience supporting professional / sales and non-exempt manufacturing positions
Can be as an in-house recruiter or a recruiter at a staffing agency
Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources Management or a related field
Experience in conducting different types of job interviews, such as structured, stress, or competency-based
job_descriptions.ca07ca82ea3eef43:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
The Walt Disney Company's Media & Entertainment Distribution (DMED) is a new, global business segment for The Walt Disney Company with the mission of providing consumers around the world access to the content they want most, on the latest platforms, at a time of rapidly-evolving consumer habits. Combining the Company's direct-to-consumer streaming services – ESPN+, the Disney+ streaming service and its ownership stake in Hulu - alongside Disney's international media businesses, DMED aligns cutting-edge technology with world-class content and beloved brands to expand the Company's global footprint and deliver highly-personalized entertainment experiences to diverse consumers around the world.

The Recruiter is an integral member of our recruiting team responsible for delivering top talent and excellent service to our clients across the segment. This individual will develop robust candidate pipelines and be capable of generating results in a fast paced environment. This professional will be directly responsible for the full service client management and recruiting of our disciplines. The Recruiter will partner with client stake holders to develop and execute recruiting strategies. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to proactively identify top level talent through a variety of sourcing/recruiting techniques. This professional will ensure impeccable recruitment execution to achieve seamless candidate and client recruitment experience.

Responsibilities:
Act as a consultative, recruitment subject matter expert by applying best practices for full recruitment lifecycle and strategic talent acquisition
Facilitate the end to end recruitment process; including recruit/source, interview, selection and on boarding of new hires
Drive the development and implementation of comprehensive recruitment plans
Collaborate with clients and HR partners to develop a strong understanding of department culture, business strategy and talent profiles to deliver on the hiring needs of the business
Demonstrate ability to attract, influence and convert hard to find passive talent through your understanding of the business and employee value proposition
Conduct in-depth screens and assess potential candidates for level of interest, qualifications, and compensation
Use innovative sourcing and marketing/branding techniques to engage both active and passive candidates. Sourcing tools include but not limited to: LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr and diversity-oriented sites & blogs
Utilize recruitment tools such as applicant tracking system, CRM etc. for workflow tracking, communication and management of active and passive candidates
Ongoing research of competitive landscape and market insights/trends to remain current and relevant in functional technology expertise and demographics
Ensure compliance with EEO/Diversity policies, including FedCon requirements when necessary
Drive facilitation of continuous improvement via measurement tools, scorecards, and recruitment analytics
Participate in special projects/task forces as assigned
Represent Company for recruiting purposes at identified networking and industry events, job fairs, conferences, etc.
Develop a broad professional network of top technology talent


Basic Qualifications:
Minimum of 3 years of large corporate and agency recruiting experience, across various disciplines, including sales coordinators, sales planners, account managers etc.
Extensive experience developing and executing fully comprehensive sourcing/recruitment plans
Experience meeting time to fill, quantity, quality, diversity, veteran and internal hiring
Deep experience using social media tools for sourcing and branding efforts; tools include but not limited to: LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr and Diversity oriented sites & Blogs
Expertise in advanced Boolean and/or Semantic searching
Proven ability to support/interact and advise senior level management
A strong business acumen with the ability to understand & interpret complex business needs and business structure
Ability to analyze job descriptions and candidate profiles to determine target profile needs and appropriate match
Experience in a role where multiple projects and competing demands are the norm
Excellent consultative skills and proven success developing strong, collaborative relationships across multiple departments and levels
Proven experience engaging high-potential prospects through targeted sourcing and cold calling
Knowledge of enterprise-wide Applicant Tracking systems and proven experience working in a results measured environment
Must be able to work effectively in a team environment and communicate effectively across multiple departments and levels.
Work with little direction or supervision
Strong negotiation and presentation skills
Outstanding attention to detail
Resourceful, with exceptional problem solving skills
Ability to maintain confidential information
BA/BS strongly preferred
Recruiting or HR certifications nice to have
job_descriptions.40e8fd4f1366231f:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeContractFull Job DescriptionSummary
Posted: Mar 15, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200231206
Do you genuinely believe that talent is the greatest asset of any company? The main aim of Apple’s recruiting team is to search the world for unique talent to maintain Apple as the most innovative company in the world. We strive to make Apple the most diverse — open to all people, all backgrounds, and all perspectives. Join the team and help build the extraordinary talent it takes to make extraordinary products.
We’re seeking a Sr. Technical Recruiter to join the Internet Software & Services Recruiting team based in Cupertino, CA. In this role you'll have the opportunity to join an amazing, collaborative, and agile team responsible for hiring best-in-class talent. As part of the larger People organization, Recruiting acts as the gatekeepers of Apple culture by providing an extraordinary experience to both our internal business partners and candidates. Apple Recruiters are strategic partners for the business they work with, and compelling ambassadors of Apple.
Key Qualifications
Consult with hiring managers to deliver innovative and efficient solutions for hiring needs
Proven background in using innovative research & sourcing methods to hire for niche areas and hard to fill technical roles
Expertise in competing with top technology companies in the Seattle market
Are able to influence and get business teams to think differently about diversity
Deliver an exceptional customer and candidate experience
Reporting and analyzing data on recruitment
Lead ad-hoc confidential/business critical assignments
Excellent communicator, interact credibly on the telephone and in-person with people from all levels of an organization
Highly organized and able to prioritize and drive efficiencies
Advocates, educates and influences their business to embrace Apple’s recruitment strategies, processes and philosophy
You are someone who positively and actively builds cross-functional relationships
Description
As a Technical Recruiter at Apple, your main goal is to identify, assess, and bring top talent to Apple. You will be responsible for guiding hiring managers and candidates through Apple's selection process, performing full lifecycle recruiting, and maintaining excellent relations with hiring managers, candidates, and the community at large. This position is technically focused so experience with leading-edge software and hardware products is essential.
Education & Experience
Minimum BS/BA or equivalent experience
Additional RequirementsHave experience in diversity recruiting and are able to source and create a pipeline of diverse candidatesYou display and energize a sense of urgency and priority within teamsBe viewed as approachable, candid, inventive, knowledgeable, helpful, and engagedA high level of curiosity and emotional intelligence is essentialDrive hiring processes that produce high quality outcomes
job_descriptions.04c5f5d4e1bcab54:
Job detailsSalary$53,423 - $96,025 a yearJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionDuties
Summary
Due to the Pandemic, and individual states with different phases of reopening, the selectee’s report date to the official duty station/facility may be delayed until such time as employees are allowed to report to the workplace. The person selected may telework up to the maximum extent possible, up to and including full time, until it is safe to relocate.

Responsibilities
The incumbent serves as a Human Resources Specialist in a regional HR office. Provides consultation services to managers and staff offices in the areas of recruitment and placement. Collaborates with managers on recruitment options, hiring flexibilities and incentives; prepares vacancy announcements; rates and ranks application packages for various positions; adjudicates veteran’s preference; issues certificate of eligible applicants to managers; ensures legal appointment and assignment of selectees; prepares and manages case files. Provides guidance on FAA Core Compensation plan and other FAA pay systems to LOB personnel, applicants and employees. Completes Requests for Personnel Actions (SF-52) for various types of personnel actions; prepares and manages required documents for case files on personnel actions; updates workload data; closes out merit promotion and recruitment files. Applies comprehensive knowledge of staffing principles, laws and regulations; interpret HR policies and other regulatory guidance; utilize high level knowledge and skill in the analysis and interpretation of governing laws, policies and HR principles and practices to effectively advise on and/or resolve operational problems which can range from recurring to more complex issues.
Refers problems and work issues to more experienced HR Specialists or the Employment Services Manager when guidelines are not available or applicable.
Work is typically reviewed frequently during assignments and at completion to ensure timeliness, policy compliance and alignment with HR guidance, practices and procedures.
To ensure quality, the work of the incumbent will be evaluated regularly during progress and upon completion. While duties may not change, the level of supervision is greater at the FV-F position than at the FV-G position.
Travel Required

General experience could have been gained in administrative, professional, technical, investigative, or other responsible work. Experience in substantive and relevant secretarial, clerical, or other responsible work may be qualifying as long as it provided evidence of the knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSA's) necessary to perform the duties of this position. Experience of a general nature (typing, filing, routine procedural processing, maintaining records, or other non-specialized tasks) is not creditable.
G-BAND: To qualify for this position at the FV-G level you must demonstrate in your application that you possess at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the FV-F or FG/GS-9 level. Specialized experience includes: Performing a variety of assignments requiring the application of HR or related concepts, principles, regulations and policy. Conducting research to identify and resolve problems or concerns. Coordinating and performing employment and related activities, such as assisting or coordinating recruitment, assessing qualifications of applicants, processing personnel actions, and other HR or related office activities.
This position may be filled at the F or G band.

job_descriptions.efb3bb09d6f59dda:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionSUMMARY
Rakuten is hiring a Talent Sourcer join our team. This is a full-time remote position, recruiting for the San Francisco Bay Area. You will build passive candidate pipelines against multiple requisitions in product design and engineering. You will work closely with other sourcers and recruiters - primarily responsible for top of funnel metrics. The ideal candidate is also comfortable in a fast-paced, metric-based environment. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a variety of roles across the entire organization. As a key member of the Talent Acquisition team, you will see your contributions shape Rakuten’s growth and culture.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Partner closely and effectively with recruiters and hiring teams to understand staffing needs to build and execute sourcing strategies
Source, screen and deliver highly qualified passive candidates using multiple tools and techniques
Use competitive market intelligence and industry knowledge to research and identify new recruiting channels
Build talent pipelines and maintain network of prospects through proactive market research, ongoing relationship management and sourcing campaigns
Maintain recruitment database
Build strong partnerships with hiring managers and hiring teams to source and identify candidates that will excel at Rakuten

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities)
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
A minimum of 2 years’ hands-on talent sourcing experience in product design and/or engineering
Demonstrated ability to identify, attract and qualify candidates
Strong understanding of cutting edge tools and sourcing techniques
Able to exercise independent judgment and discretion
Excellent organizational, analytical, written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills; practices a collaborative approach
Bachelor's degree preferred
Prior experience with working in fast-paced startup environment is preferred

RAKUTEN SHUGI PRINCIPLES
Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success.
Always improve, always advance. Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen.
Be passionately professional. Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best.
Hypothesize - Practice - Validate - Shikumika. Use the Rakuten Cycle to success in unknown territory.
Maximize Customer Satisfaction. The greatest satisfaction for workers in a service industry is to see their customers smile.
Speed!! Speed!! Speed!! Always be conscious of time. Take charge, set clear goals, and engage your team.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionRecruiter
Corporate Overview
QuinStreet makes the digital media channel affordable at scale for marketing clients. We match high-intent consumers in one of the nation’s largest media networks to the right solution and the right client.
Our industry leading segmentation & matching technology platform allows marketing clients to target and reach “research & compare” customer prospects, segment by segment. Our databases and optimization algorithms are built from almost 20 years and billions of dollars of online media experience.
We believe in the direct measurability of digital media. We believe in performance marketing. (We pioneered it.) And we believe in the advantages of technology. We bring all of this together to deliver truly great results for our clients in the world’s biggest channel.
Job Category
QuinStreet is looking to add a dynamic Recruiter to join our amazing team! We’re looking for candidates who are detail orientated, creative, proactive, has a great attitude, and want to join a fun team. We need someone passionate about Recruiting that has a track record of success hiring in the areas of Marketing, Analytics, Sales, Account Managers, and Business Development.
Responsibilities
Partner with hiring managers to understand the roles and ideal candidates
Identify, screen, and hire the Bay Area’s top talent
Build and maintain strong candidate pipelines
Successfully prioritize and manage a large, diverse requisition load in a fast-paced, constantly changing work environment
Qualifications
Bachelors (BS/BA) degree
At least 2+ years of Corporate Recruiting or Sourcing experience on the Business side
Knowledge of candidate tracking software systems
Be passionate about recruiting and thrive in a fun, fast paced work environment
QuinStreet is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, pregnancy status, sex, age, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristics protected by law.
job_descriptions.82da81f79a57a8a5:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAlbertsons Companies has an exciting opportunity to be a part of the Talent Acquisition department. In this role, you will be a trusted thought partner to leaders throughout the corporate supply chain organization, drive talent efforts based on organizational needs, and develop proactive recruitment strategies to fill critical corporate supply chain roles. As the first point of contact for future team members, you will be accountable for upholding and championing Albertsons Companies brand and culture. To do this, you will recruit with intent, hire with emotional and cultural intelligence, and welcome team members with approachability and meaningful engagement.
What does it take to be successful here? You are a fast-paced, highly motivated, people-centered, and innovative Talent Acquisition Strategist who will help us scale the Albertsons Companies Supply Chain Team. You will optimize the candidate and hiring manager experiences and manage communication and engagement throughout the candidate's lifecycle. You have experience recruiting in the supply chain space and understand how to connect the right talent with opportunities to meet business objectives.

Position Overview:
The Talent Acquisition Representative will report to the Senior Director of Talent Acquisition. This position will be based in Boise, Idaho, or one of our regional offices (Pleasanton CA, Portland OR, Denver CO, Dallas TX, Phoenix AZ, Seattle WA, Chicago, IL, or Orange County CA). Additional travel will be required if not located in Boise.

As a Talent Acquisition Representative, you must have depth and breadth of knowledge of the talent in Supply Chain, Distribution Centers, and Manufacturing plants. You will work closely with Human Resources and supply chain business leaders in devising talent acquisition strategies and recruitment process, as well as execution of the day-to-day sourcing, recruiting, and networking. You will be responsible for the recruitment processes including sourcing, interviewing, candidate evaluation, hiring, and offer negotiation as well as coaching, mentoring, and leading hiring managers in recruiting best practices.

Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Supply Chain Talent Acquisition Strategy: Creating a formal plan of action to successfully identify, recruit, and hire high-quality talent. This may include job posting optimization, recruiting marketing channel development, job board procurement, digital and non-digital employment marketing, comprehensive recruitment campaign planning, talent planning. Delivering weekly/monthly reporting to HR and business leaders as well as a continuous quality assurance approach to strategy.
Supply Chain Employer Value Proposition -- Contribute to, activate, and manage a compelling narrative detailing to jobseekers the value of employment within our supply chain organization. Devise go to market strategy, marketing, and media to make brand accessible and visible to jobseekers for all supply chain roles. Continually revisit value proposition to ensure market positioning is "fresh" and current for each role.
Diversity & Inclusion -- Develop an approach that considers supply chain talent from across the nation, our diversity and inclusion strategy and goals, and draws diverse talent into consideration for all roles. Produce diverse slates of candidates and assemble diverse panels of interviewers to ensure our supply chain teams are as diverse as the communities and patients they serve. Foster a diverse and inclusive team and work environment and role model our culture and leadership practices.
Sourcing & Recruiting: Work with internal teams and hiring managers to anticipate needs and proactively identify talent to meet and exceed those needs. Evaluate internal and external talent for opportunities across the supply chain organization. Owning the process from opening the req to candidates first day while building optimal experiences for candidates.
Data & Analytics. Leverage data to create actionable talent intelligence, establish ROI, and draw insights for business leaders. Create forward-looking plans based on talent trends and analytics that turn information into clear data narratives or dashboards for business partners and leadership. Measure effort effectiveness execute against KPIs and hold yourself accountable to deliver against effectiveness measures. Adept at measuring marketing, media, and engagement, effectiveness to demonstrate overall value and identify opportunities to continually improve talent acquisition processes.

Qualifications:

Expert level proficiency in networking, social recruiting, web-based tool utilization (i.e., LinkedIn, Indeed, etc.)
Experience in developing in-role success profiles and devising talent acquisition process to procure talent congruent with the aforementioned profile
Experience developing reporting at a leadership level to convey talent acquisition effectiveness and convey market intelligence clearly and succinctly
Ability to comprehend supply chain and organizational objectives and provide go to market talent acquisition approaches that ensure the business is positioned with world-class talent to attain defined objectives
Proven ability to coordinate and align a diverse set of business stakeholders at all levels of a business
Possesses a continuous quality assurance mindset and provide retrospective analysis to improve future talent acquisition approaches
Strong influence - constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery while balancing the need for great collaboration across a variety of stakeholders and business units to achieve team and organizational objectives
High detail orientation and broad background in leading large and complex talent acquisition projects
Build long-term relationships with past and potential candidates to leverage relationship-based recruiting
Savvy with data - You know how to gather, share, and leverage data to make decisions. You utilize data to measure initiative and recruiter effectiveness, program costs, and build predictive talent insights to allow the business to "see around corners."
Self-directed - Able to navigate ambiguity and work independently
Self-starter with a demonstrated ability to thrive in a team-based environment that is fast-paced, rapidly changing, and service-oriented
Advanced proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and SharePoint) required

Preferred Skills & Qualifications:

5+ years' experience in full cycle corporate recruiting environment
3+ years' experience in human resources or talent acquisition capacity in supply chain
Bachelor's degree or high education level with emphasis in human resources or MBA
Experience recruiting within the Oracle Recruiting Cloud system

About us:
Albertsons Companies is at the forefront of the revolution in retail. With a fixation on innovation and building culture, our team is rallying our company around a unique vision: forging a retail winner that is admired for national strength, deep roots in the communities we serve, and a team that has passion for food and delivering great service.

Albertsons Culture Principles:
Compassion: We always treat each other with kindness and respect
Team: We always support and recognize each other
Inclusive: We always value everyone's perspective
Learning: We always strive to grow and develop ourselves and others
Competitive: We always act with integrity to win over the customer
Ownership: We always take actions to drive our success

Physical Environment:

Must sit, stand for extended periods of time
May spend long periods of time at desk or computer terminal
Will use keyboards, telephone, and other office equipment during the course of normal workday
Workday is fast paced; some evening and weekend work may be required

Travel Requirements: approximately 10% travel (dependent on location)

job_descriptions.42399899b52f2382:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout Us:
AUDIENCEX is an independent trading desk and leading digital advertising partner for brands and agencies. We offer strategic, unbiased, omnichannel performance marketing solutions powered by high impact creative, innovative technology, targeted media buying, and data-driven analysis to help our clients engage with and acquire customers throughout the entire purchase funnel. Named one of the Fastest Growing and Most Successful Companies in America by Inc, Deloitte and the Financial Times, AUDIENCEX is headquartered in Los Angeles and operates in offices throughout North America, including New York, Chicago, Dallas, Miami, Detroit, St. Louis and Charlotte.
Position Overview:
As a Senior Recruiter, you will redefine the way we recruit for talent as we scale our teams for high growth. In partnership with People Ops leadership, you will be responsible for developing and executing the talent acquisition strategy for a variety of prioritized roles. Additionally, you will partner closely with our leaders across departments, including Sales, Account Management, Strategy, Analytics, Programmatic Strategy, Marketing and Platform Solutions to identify and attract top talent to the organization.
As a key member of the team, this is an exciting opportunity to shape and build a unique approach to attracting and securing skilled and diverse candidates in the ad tech space.
This role is based out of our headquarters in Marina Del Rey, CA and reports to the Chief People Officer. The team is currently operating remotely.
Responsibilities:
Use a combination of recruiting techniques including sourcing efforts through social media sites and platforms to build and engage networks, and assess and hire talent
Define, design and implement recruiting programs, and drive sourcing strategy recommendations for a variety of roles
Develop training, toolkits and best practices to equip our organization with tools and resources aimed at increasing underrepresented talent in our pipelines
Be a thought partner with leaders at all levels to establish recruitment plans, define strategies, and deliver solutions in how we recruit for talent
Act as an advocate for internal clients and candidates throughout the hiring process by establishing regular touch points and providing swift following through, resulting in a best-in-class candidate experience
Partner closely with hiring managers and the People Ops team throughout the recruitment cycle from identification and assessment through to the offer stage
Collaborate with People Ops and leadership to share competitive intelligence and prospective candidate leads
Maintain organization and candidate flow utilizing Lever, our applicant tracking system (ATS)
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
Seasoned level of experience building talent acquisition programs and recruiting talent in the ad tech, advertising or performance marketing space
Track record of hiring top-tier talent within sales, account management, strategy, marketing, ad operations and analytics functions in a timely manner
Results-oriented and highly self-motivated with strong sourcing and outreach skills
Experience in building diverse pipelines and attracting diverse talent
Mindset of putting the candidate first in everything you do
Experienced in identifying, engaging and closing passive senior candidates
Ability to partner with and influence stakeholders at all levels and drive them toward hiring goals and program outcomes
Exceptional interpersonal communication and organizational skills
Experience managing competing priorities and multiple projects simultaneously
Strong organizational and project management skills
Ability to work well under pressure
Experience working with a variety of ATS systems like Lever or Greenhouse along with sourcing tools such as LinkedIn Recruiter
Previous recruitment agency experience is preferred
AUDIENCEX is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics.
job_descriptions.48adf62dc8e2b815:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout Gap Inc.
Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.
This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our team is made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.
About the role
As a recruiter, you’re responsible for full lifecycle recruiting and understand the importance of each step. Networking comes naturally to you and you thrive off of making connections that may not naturally happen. You identify, develop, and execute effective sourcing strategies to build teams and organizations. You’re a champion of both the business and talent and are responsible for finding talent that no one else can through the relationships you build and the creative and innovative sourcing techniques you employ.
What you'll do
Manage full lifecycle recruiting including: offer process and letter generation, reference checks, salary recommendations, and offer acceptance/turn downs.
Negotiate offers by partnering with hiring manager, senior management, benefits, relocation, immigration and compensation departments and HR Generalists.
Own and define staffing strategy and deliver a diverse candidate slate to hiring managers and recruiters when required.
Effectively manage and build relationships and consult on industry trends with both internal and external business partners.
Ensure the recruiting needs of the functional team are met while maintaining recruiter and candidate satisfaction through monthly and/or quarterly reviews with the business.
Partner with functional area’s HR Generalists to support HR initiatives and vision.
Manage relationships with hiring managers and candidates to ensure a positive candidate experience.
Educate and train business partners and hiring managers on hiring.
Collaborate across teams to support improvements and share best practices.
Participate in annual strategic staffing initiatives including compensation guidelines, workflow, and process improvement.
Partner with global mobility and immigration partners.
Partner with talent branding to ensure advertising strategies align with hiring needs.
Travel to meet top talent as necessary.
Who you are
Bachelor’s degree preferred and/or 3+ years of full lifecycle recruiting experience.
You have experience creating and executing written and visual communications related to talent branding on various social platforms.
You’re tech savvy and have a thorough understanding of applicant tracking systems and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.).
You’re great at multitasking, can flex and work within multiple functions and/or channels as needed.
You’re a problem solver with a focus on continuous improvement. You’re always learning and can effectively articulate opportunities and new strategies to business partners.
Being organized motivates you. You can effectively prioritize and manage multiple tasks in an environment with competing demands.
You can maintain professionalism and focus in an ambiguous environment and handle confidential information with discretion and maturity.
Knowledge of EEO, ADA, and employment laws.
Benefits at Gap Inc.
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*
Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*
Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*
Employee stock purchase plan.*
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*
See more of the benefits we offer.
For eligible employees
Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Humans Rights Campaign for the fourteenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2019 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the second year in a row.
job_descriptions.31a172fea50852ad:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAxos:

Born digital, Axos Bank has reinvented the banking model and grown to over $14 billion in assets since our founding in 2000. With a broad and ever-growing range of financial products, Axos Bank is rated among the top 5 digital banks in the country! Axos Financial is our holding company and publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "AX (NYSE: AX).
We bring together human insight and digital expertise to anticipate the needs of our customers. Our team members are innovative, technologically sophisticated, and motivated to achieve.
Learn more about working here!
The Opportunity:

As a fast-growing FinTech company, Axos is expanding our Talent Acquisitions team to recruit for the various departments across the company. We are looking for an experienced Recruiter to join us in helping to attract and hire top professionals in both our San Diego office, as well as our other office locations across the country.
The Role:
Manage the Axos’ recruitment process from the initial opening of a position through hire, including sourcing, resume review, interviewing, testing, reference checks, etc.
Utilize all available networks in the market, to ensure open positions are filled as efficiently as possible
Work closely with HR team and managers to ensure all team members are in compliance with policies, procedures, laws, standards, and other government regulations
Develop a solid understanding of the organizational structure, all functions of the company, and the Axos’ culture and values, to efficiently focus on developing a pipeline of desirable talent in our multiple markets
Consult with hiring managers on the landscape and local market data for specific positions and skill sets
Help craft job descriptions that depict an accurate and attractive portrayal of the position
Serve as an advisor/consultant to hiring managers, helping to evaluate candidates both pre and post interview, and help determine how to proceed with prospective candidates
Understand the capabilities and characteristics of high performers, and develop interview techniques to differentiate between high and low performing candidates
Continue to develop and implement creative initiatives to attract top talent, as well improve the overall experience for candidates, managers, and the Talent Acquisition team
Train hiring managers on Axos’ Recruitment and HR policies and procedures
Ad-hoc projects related to automating and streamlining our recruitment processes and systems to do more of what we do best
Are You A Fit? :
3+ years' demonstrated successful, direct recruiting experience in a fast-paced, dynamic organization
Exceptional project management skills, verbal/written communication with stakeholders, and delivery of projects on time using an ATS and/or CRM system
Relevant experience preferably in an Agency and/or internal recruiting role
Process improvement initiatives with significant, measurable benefits
Innovative ideas that transition to substantial shifts in thinking and behavior
Bachelor's degree
Preferred:
Banking, financial services
LinkedIn Recruiter
iCIMS
Social media
Apply directly for consideration as we are not using any outside agencies for any of our openings:

Pre-Employment Drug Test:
All offers are contingent upon the candidate successfully passing a credit check, criminal background check, and pre-employment drug screening, which includes screening for marijuana. Axos Bank is a federally regulated banking institution. At the federal level, marijuana is an illegal schedule 1 drug; therefore, we will not employ any person who tests positive for marijuana, regardless of state legalization.
Equal Employment Opportunity:
Axos Bank is an Equal Opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religious creed, color, sex (including pregnancy, breast feeding and related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, military and veteran status, marital status, age, protected medical condition, genetic information, physical disability, mental disability, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws.
Job Functions and Work Environment:
While performing the duties of this position, the employee is required to sit for extended periods of time. Manual dexterity and coordination are required while operating standard office equipment such as computer keyboard and mouse, calculator, telephone, copiers, etc.
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee may encounter while performing the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.
job_descriptions.66fdb031a70c760c:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionGo Put the World on Vacation
At Travel + Leisure Co. our goal is simple: to put the world on vacation. We’re the world’s leading membership and travel company, with a portfolio of nearly 20 resort, travel club, and lifestyle travel brands. Our global team of associates brings hospitality to millions, turning vacation inspiration into exceptional travel experiences through our products and services: Wyndham Destinations, the largest vacation ownership company with 230 vacation club resort locations across the globe; Panorama, the world’s foremost membership travel business that includes RCI, the largest vacation exchange company, along with industry-leading travel technology, and membership travel brands; and Travel + Leisure Group, offering travel products and services all inspired by top online and print travel content, including travel booking platform BookTandL.com, subscription travel clubs and branded consumer products.
Position Profile
A successful recruiter for Wyndham Destinations must effectively source, recruit, and manage the sales and marketing hiring process.
Maintain the recruiting and retention programs that will meet and/or exceed monthly site goals.
Partner with other recruiters to share best practices and maintain region-wide objectives.
Consistently document and report weekly/monthly/quarterly metrics on all programs for area/site statistical analysis.
Manage/implement the site's sales and marketing hiring process within the scope of responsibility.
Develop a yearly recruiting action plan and adjust monthly as needed.
Build the site's brand recruitment advertising and sourcing by setting standards and developing a site sourcing library of creative visual collateral.
Develop a consistent and creative flow of well-negotiated site-specific sourcing options.
Work closely with hiring managers and trainers to ensure corporate and site sales hiring processes are being followed and that appropriate candidate profiles are being identified.
Manage site recruiting media campaigns, including methods, content, and distribution within budget as needed.
Actively participate in site/area recruiting networking projects for contributing and collecting best practices for distribution to all sites.

Qualifications

Exempt and non-exempt recruiting experience in full life-cycle environment.
Agency/Search firm experience preferred.
Sales/Marketing Recruitment experience is a plus.
Ability to source "passive" candidates via direct sourcing.
Occasionally work nights and weekends as needed.
Bachelor's degree preferred.
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrated strong proactive recruiting, sourcing, presentation, interviewing, negotiating and networking skills.
Intermediate in Microsoft Office including MS Excel.
Experience with Applicant Tracking Systems (preferably Workday).

Benefits, Compensation, and Training

Yearly Salary (Exempt) with Paid Vacation Time
Comprehensive Medical, Vision, and Dental Coverage within 30 days
401K Matching
Tuition Reimbursement

A World of Inclusion
Hospitality is at the heart of all we do at Travel + Leisure Co., including how we treat each member of our growing community. Here, you’ll find a team that’s inclusive, values diversity, and is built on a foundational respect for people from all over the world.
We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to mycareer@wyn.com, including the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.
job_descriptions.91193229eb2dab6b:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCity Year has a team of recruiters distributed across the nation to recruit more than 3,000 qualified and diverse AmeriCorps members to complete a year of service at one of City Year’s 29 service locations. Recruiters are responsible for generating interest and cultivating candidates within their designated portfolios to apply to serve as AmeriCorps members. Recruiters are location based and work within one of three regional teams. Recruiter’s portfolios are organized around three recruitment strategies: 1) developing a deep network of relationships within college campuses or partner organizations who will champion City Year to potential prospects, 2) generating leads and applicants through direct outreach to candidates in person or virtually and 3) cultivating leads sourced through marketing campaigns to apply to City Year.
Job Description
This recruiter should be within commuting distance to the City Year San Jose office and will be recruiting from the Northern California/Bay Area.
You will identify opportunities to source candidates through events, online platforms, direct outreach and partnerships (e.g. career centers)
You will foster a set of relationships with partners such as career centers, college deans, professors, student organization leaders to promote City Year opportunities to future candidates
You will directly engage prospects to inform them about City Year, generate interest to apply and guide them as needed through the application process.
You will consistently leverage City Year’s customer relationship management system to track engagements with candidates, events and partners to inform future candidate engagements, decision making and institutional knowledge.
Qualifications:
Passionate about recruiting a high quality and diverse corps for our students
Anchored in a commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion
Enjoy meeting and engaging with new people
Organized and can support multiple candidates and partnerships at varying stages in the recruitment process
Always seeking to learn, improve and innovate
Compensation and Benefits
Full time employees are entitled to compensation commensurate with experience. Benefits for full time employees include health insurance with Flexible Spending Account, paid vacation, holidays, parental leave, 401K, and more.
City Year is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse workforce. Individuals from all backgrounds are encouraged to apply, including persons with disabilities and veterans.
job_descriptions.9ce785a6df1833ad:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
At Disney, we‘re storytellers. We make the impossible, possible. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and pushing the envelope to bring stories to life through our movies, products, interactive games, parks and resorts, and media networks. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled creative content to audiences around the world.

The Senior Talent Sourcer role will include research, talent identification and engagement and encompasses combining consultative, influencing and advocacy skills to find and attract top talent and deliver optimal results to recruiting partners and hiring managers. The Senior Talent Sourcer participates in the development of sourcing strategies, researches and creates target lists of companies and individuals for active and future openings, identifies, engages with and converts passive talent to active and future prospects.

The Senior Talent Sourcer is an integral member of Talent Acquisition, combining consultative, influencing and advocacy skills to find and attract top talent and deliver excellent results to recruiting partners and hiring managers. Integrated with the support of a sourcing center of excellence, this professional will directly be responsible for the full-service candidate sourcing and research support for a variety of legal specific functions across The Walt Disney Company. Examples of these functions include attorney, paralegal and coordinator roles. The Senior Talent Sourcer partners with Enterprise Legal Recruiters on projects and searches to develop sourcing strategies, construct target lists of companies, candidates, prospects and leads, develop pipelines of talent, contact high-potential prospects, conduct candidate interviews, maintain progress reports, captures market data to tell the passive talent market’s story and assess candidate qualifications. The ideal candidate will possess the ability to proactively identify top talent through a variety of sourcing techniques. Additional research and consultative activities may occur in support of specific clients or overall initiatives. Focus areas and responsibilities for the Senior Talent Sourcer range across Talent Strategies / Talent Community Development, Subject Matter Expertise, Requisition Support, Market Intel / Addressable Market Analytics, Strategic Business Partnerships, Sourcing Reporting & Analytics, and Advancing the Sourcing Function.

Responsibilities:
Perform candidate sourcing and research activities through the development and execution of full lifecycle research and sourcing strategies and plans; ensuring an optimal experience for candidates, clients, and talent acquisition partners
Effectively articulate a compelling value proposition and business strategy to prospects and candidates
Cultivate relationships with talent for current and future opportunities
Network closely within the industry and specialized functional areas to identify the right talent and companies to target
Identify and articulate the qualifications, strengths, and opportunities of candidates to hiring managers and talent consultants
Leverage a variety of sourcing methods, techniques and technologies, inclusive of social media, leveraging Boolean searches to scan through publicly-accessible code repositories, etc.
Implement key strategies and partnerships to include, but not limited to professional associations, and diversity recruitment conferences, community outreach programs and events, industry networking events and associations, etc.
Responsible for creating target lists of companies and individuals for active and future openings. Research target companies to develop lists of individuals (names / titles) as a match for active & future roles through utilizing industry directories, networking, and/or conducting searches within online tools, resume databases, direct sourcing, industry research, networking events, blogs, associations and career events
Fully leverage for optimal talent relationship management utilizing campaign management, lead tracking, and to identify and continuously engage with leads, referrals, and other potential prospects
Monitor continuous improvement through measures of success analytics and report them on a regular basis
Attend meetings with recruitment partners and hiring teams
Conduct in-depth screens and assess potential candidates for level of interest, qualifications, compensation and convert hard to find passive talent through an understanding of the business and employee value proposition
Participate in ad hoc projects as necessary
Talent Strategies / Talent Community Development:
Identify and successfully engage with legal talent in specific disciplines.
Tell a compelling and consistent message to candidates that aligns with the company brand and values.
Develop robust communities of talent and candidate pipelines across a diverse set of functional areas and generate rapid results in a fast-paced environment
Market Intel / Addressable Market Analytics:
Collect and frame-up external talent market data to enable partners to inform and influence decisions
Strategic Business Partnerships:
Proactively inform recruiting partners on progress and recommend shifts in sourcing strategy.
Participate in enterprise-wide talent acquisition projects, in conjunction with Talent Acquisition Leaders.
Explain complex information to others in straightforward situations
Subject Matter Expertise:
Develop knowledge / building skills in functions / specialties. Build toward operating at as a SME on various external talent markets for specific professional discipline(s)
Lead the development of subject matter expertise of high niche legal areas and funnel intelligence back to recruitment partners and Talent Acquisition Leaders. Enhance the organization’s understanding of the legal space through research and synthesis of knowledge acquired, staying current on market trends. Proactively educate recruitment partners, hiring leaders and Talent Acquisition leaders. Consult on talent market throughout lifecycle of individual searches
Lead and synthesize gaining understanding of legal groups within each respective segment at TWDC, look for trends in skillsets so as to share market intelligence and talent across segments
Basic Qualifications:
7+ years of work experience in sourcing or recruiting candidates with heavy emphasis on research, sourcing, recruitment and/or other relevant experience / transferrable job skills.
Extensive experience developing and executing fully comprehensive sourcing/recruitment plans on niche search areas.
Experience in consulting and/or working in a consultative role where multiple projects and competing demands are the norm
Ability to analyze job descriptions and candidate profiles to determine target profile needs and appropriate match
Knowledge of the recruitment lifecycle, inclusive of Boolean and/or Semantic searching, data mining, professional networking, passive candidate cold calling and innovative sourcing techniques
Proven experience contacting, attracting, qualifying and converting high-potential prospects through multiple channels
Demonstrated experience speaking with and assessing candidates’ skills and qualifications
Business acumen with the ability to understand business needs and business structure
Excellent communication and presentation skills, including verbal and written
Strong curiosity, creativity and a drive to succeed a must
Outstanding attention to detail
Experience in a role where multiple projects and competing demands are the norm
Resourceful, with exceptional problem solving skills
Demonstrated experience developing strong, collaborative relationships
Ability to maintain confidential information
Preferred Qualifications:
Search firm and/or corporate legal recruiting experience
Experience contacting high-potential prospects through targeted cold calling
Proficiency using a variety of online search / sourcing tools, ideally including ATS and CRM systems
Required Education
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience required

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout The Brand: For over 30 years, the Nickelodeon Animation Studio continues to be one of the largest producers of television animation in the world, reflecting all kids today. Based in Burbank, Calif., with offices in New York, the Studio, designed by our artists and for our artists, is home to the world's greatest creative talents. Our campus of creativity houses top-notch talent, storytellers, artists, production teams, voice actors, cartoon experts and more. At Nickelodeon, we are always looking to recruit dedicated craftspeople to help bring groundbreaking new ideas to life and that starts with you! We are leading the way in animated content for TV series, TV movies, shorts and theatrical features. Some of our new upcoming original animated series include, Kamp Koral: SpongeBob's Under Years, Rugrats, Middlemost Post, Star Trek: Prodigy, Big Nate and Santiago of the Seas, among others.Our content development teams are creator-driven, our work culture is collaborative, our mentorship of new talent is second to none, and we are committed to hiring inclusively to reflect authenticity in the diverse stories we want to tell.Join us! Overview and Responsibilities:

Summary:
Assist the VP of Recruitment, Director of People and Culture in their daily Recruitment, Outreach and Talent Development functions.
Responsibilities:

Answer VP of Recruitment’s phone
Copy and distribute necessary department-related documents
Assist Recruitment, Outreach and Talent Development when requested
Assist with weekly schedules
Orders (swag, birthdays, meals, etc.) and department supplies as needed
Update recruitment/outreach/talent development documents
Answer mail
Arrange travel for VP of Recruitment, Director of People and Culture or recruitment team when necessary
Keep key personnel updated as to VP of Recruitment’s schedule
Help out on team projects wherever it’s needed
Assist with onboarding, orientation and new hire paperwork when needed
Basic Qualifications:
Knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook, Google Suite, familiarity with internet and email
Knowledge of FileMaker Pro, Photoshop, Illustrator a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in high pressure, fast-paced production environment
Good time management skills; good multi-tasker
Additional Qualifications:
BA/BS preferred
Previous experience supporting HR/Recruitment departments; or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeInternshipFull Job DescriptionJob Brief

To be successful in the Talent Specialist, Early Career role the chosen candidate will need 1+ years of experience managing full life cycle recruiting OR advertising agency experience looking to make the leap into talent.

Client Name:
City:
Santa Monica

3/11/21 8:44 PM

Where You’ll Be Working

We’re RPA: an independent advertising agency that puts People First. It’s a unique philosophy for a different kind of agency: where we aspire to create work that truly matters to people, for brands that respect and value people, with a team we empower and treat like people. And we do it all in the heart of sunny Santa Monica, California.

Why You’ll Never Want to Leave

Our People First philosophy means creating a culture where people like you can thrive, do meaningful work, and — we hope — stick around for a while. In an industry known for high turnover, people at RPA seem to recognize the value of an environment that truly wants to support our Associates’ lives and career growth.
 Professional Development
 Tuition Reimbursement
 Virtual Yoga and Meditation

Who You’ll Be Collaborating With

Every day, you’ll be teaming up with a diverse, enthusiastic, multi-disciplinary team of aces with a smart sense of humor. Your future work buddies include:

 A Senior Manager who read over 70 books in 2020

 A Talent Specialist who has been to every state

WFWherever You Are

Our Priority is the safety and comfort of our people. So, we'll be working from our home offices, cabins, couches, and wherever else for the foreseeable future. We'll see you back at the office when things change:

This role will be based in Los Angeles once we're back in the office. Open to non-local candidates interested in future relocation.

What You’ll Be Helping Achieve

To be successful in the Talent Specialist, Early Career role the chosen candidate will need 1+ years of experience managing full life cycle recruiting OR advertising agency experience looking to make the leap into talent.

What You’ll Be Working On

Full life cycle recruitment:
Direct sourcing, interview management and closing of intern, entry and junior level roles across all departments
Building collaborative partnerships as a talent advisor with internal teams including hiring managers and leadership

Lead the offer negotiation and offer process in a very competitive space

Utilize recruiting tools and applicant tracking system

Diversity champion:

Proactively building pipelines of diverse talent

Build relationships with organizations and groups

Be a steward of our culture, advocating for culture adds and non-traditional candidates that increase our diversity of thought

University Recruitment:
Manage Internship program across all departments and multiple locations
Create a campus strategy and process and build a diverse pipeline
Own relationship with various university campuses and industry organizations

Represent agency at early career specific events
Mentor early career applicants throughout the recruitment process
How You’ll Excel in Your Role

1+ years of recruiting and sourcing experience OR advertising agency experience looking for a change
Knowledge and experience of the integrated advertising field, digital media experience a plus
A passion for building teams and delivering exceptional candidate experience
An understanding of the entire recruiting life-cycle and ability to operate successfully within each stage
Ability to be agile in your approach and relentless in your search
Experience sourcing, interviewing, negotiating, and networking with early career candidates
An active and data driven approach to problem solving
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, at RPA we hire without consideration to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, disability or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law.

Securitas employees come from all walks of life, bringing with them a variety of distinctive skills and perspectives. United through our common purpose, we provide the security needed to safeguard our clients' assets and people. Our core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are represented by the three red dots in the Securitas logo. If you live by these values, we’re looking for you to join the Securitas team.
Our Company Mission:
Securitas’ mission is to protect homes, workplaces, and communities by providing the security services they need to protect their assets, safeguard their people, and maintain their ability to generate profits.

Our Values:
Securitas’ core values - Integrity, Vigilance and Helpfulness - are the foundation for our employees to build trust with customers, colleagues, and the surrounding community.

Integrity:
Securitas employees are honest and trusted by customers to safeguard their premises and valuables. We don’t compromise on integrity and create an open forum for our employees and customers to voice opinions, report improprieties, and share information.

Vigilance:
Seeing, hearing, and evaluating. A Securitas employee is always attentive and often notices things that others don’t. Their vigilance is necessary in order to be aware of potential risks or incidents that may take place on our customers’ premises.

Helpfulness:
As part of an on-going effort to ensure safety, Securitas employees are always ready to help if an incident occurs that requires intervention regardless of whether or not it is directly related to their job.
job_descriptions.d01e62fc758d1805:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionAbout Extend:
Extend is modernizing the $100 billion-per year extended warranty and protection plan industry using cutting edge technology, and top notch customer service. With a $40M Series B round of funding, we are ready to continue to scale our organization.
Our API-first solution allows any merchant to offer extended warranties and protection plans, both online and offline, while also providing a merchant's end customers with a vastly improved and modern support experience that eliminates many of the issues customers face today with legacy underwriters.
We are a venture backed startup based in downtown San Francisco (and since COVID began, fully remote) that is led by founders who have previously had multiple successful exits. Extend is simplifying the technology stack for the extended warranty industry, in the same way that Stripe did for online payments and Affirm did for consumer point of sale financing.
About the Role:
Hiring great talent is core to the success of any company. Extend is looking for a Recruiter to build and execute against recruiting strategies, act as a talent advisor and thought leader to our business partners, and offer a great experience to candidates and hiring managers.


What You'll Do:
Own full cycle recruitment for business functions.
Partner with dedicated sourcers to create a healthy pipeline for your roles.
Own the entire lifecycle of recruiting from kicking off a new search, job description development, building a robust evaluation strategy, sourcing and closing candidates.
Provide a seamless recruiting process for various hiring managers.
Work with our existing team to build processes and implement best practices for hiring top talent.
Help us improve and scale the candidate experience.
What You've Done:
2+ years of FLC recruiting experience either within an early stage/hyper growth startup, or within an agency.
Built strategic partnerships with hiring teams and cross functional team members
Experience recruiting for a wide array of business functions including: Revenue, Design, Product, G&A and some ad-hoc support to the Engineering teams.
Creative and engaging sourcing experience to build strong relationships with talent starting with initial outreach.
Partnering with hiring teams throughout the recruiting process, acting as an effective hiring partner and trusted advisor with their interview processes and hiring decisions.
Ability to operate well in a fast moving environment and provide team clarity to ambiguous situations.
Proven history of thriving and prioritizing in a constantly changing environment.
Life at Extend:
Working with a great team from diverse backgrounds in a collaborative and supportive environment
Competitive salary based on experience, with full medical and dental benefits
Stock in an early-stage startup growing quickly
Flexible vacation policy

job_descriptions.66e6d90dcba2063c: Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role1QualificationsBachelor's (Required)Full Job DescriptionWe are a family-owned and operated organization focused on the promotion of our distinct wines, authentic brands rooted in rich histories and crafted from our sustainably-farmed, estate-grown vineyards.ABOUT USEverything that we do – we do for the love of farm and family, its ability to root and connect people, to have a lasting impact on communities. We have grown winegrapes for generations and began our winery a decade ago to protect the future of the family farm. Our wines are estate grown sustainably certified and are expressive of our vineyard’s unique attributes. We have family control from vine to wine which ensures quality and consistency vintage to vintage.We believe in the farm – it’s ability to root communities, to connect people, and to foster a sense of place and gratitude.We believe that to have a lasting impact, our vision must span generations.We believe in responsible stewardship of the land through embracing and furthering sustainable farming practices and synergies with the natural world.We believe in a growth-mindset, the necessity of resilience, the importance of integrity and the rewards of tenacity.OPPORTUNITYWe are seeking a creative and results-driven Marketing Brand Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will be able to think strategically, create and optimize our marketing strategies, oversee the day-to-day needs of marketing department staff while being adaptable and flexible to change. This role will work in partnership with other businesses and cross-functional teams to assure that growth objectives are achieved.ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESBrand Planning & ExecutionCreate and execute annual brand marketing plans, brand programs, and brand assets (all materials, presentations, video, photography) for assigned brand(s), reviewing and updating as needed. Includes creative development, media planning, website development, advertising, merchandising, and promotion. Integrate/enhance all brand activities across all channels. Ensure consistent messaging, imagery, and quality standards.Evaluate market opportunities for new product additions or packaging updates.Work with designers and external vendors to develop/update packaging and label design.Create and execute annual DTC marketing channel plans (E-Commerce, Hospitality, Wine Club, Social Media). Includes developing/enhancing the design of social networking features; create, manage, and measure digital marketing campaigns and strategies; track, analyze, and optimize content based on qualitative and quantitative insights; proactively identify opportunities to grow business and audiences via web and digital platforms.Responsible and accountable for measuring the impact and effectiveness of all marketing initiatives.Finance and Logistics ManagementMonitor sales trends and work with team to maintain proper inventory levels.Accountable for brand financials, including brand P&L, marketing budgets, and wine pricing.Channel SupportAct as a daily point of contact for programs and activities for Community Marketing & Sales, Direct & Online Partnership Sales, E-Commerce, Hospitality, Wine Club, and Social Media.Work with each channel team member to develop needed marketing campaigns and materials.Leadership Develop a strong team, improving current performance, and encouraging and allowing for growth.Align everyone across the team with mission and vision.Cultivate cross-department relationships to ensure cohesiveness, strong communication, and alignment throughout the company allowing for exceptional business results.Actively develop your own leadership style, knowledge, and skillset.Other duties as assigned by ownership.REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIESBachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Business Administration. 5+ years of brand management experience in wine or consumer packaged goods. Wine Industry experience strongly preferred.Must be creative and desire to go above and beyond. Excellent presentation and communication skills. Strong analytical and strategic skills. Demonstrate teamwork orientation to bring out the best in those who work with them. Self-motivated team player with the ability to juggle multiple competing projects with tight deadlines and unexpected projects that develop and require immediate attention.Strong PC Skills (Windows, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher) and attention to detail.Strong interest in wine with a demonstrated knowledge of wines.Ability to work a flexible schedule including some evening and weekend events as well as travel domestically, as needed.Must be 21 years of age or over and possess a valid driver’s license.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand for extended periods of time; use hands to finger, handle, or feel, use computer/cash register, use ten-key, talk, and hear in conversations. The employee is regularly required to walk, reach with hands and arms, and bend at mid-waist. The employee must lift 30 lbs. on a regular basis and up to 50 lbs. on an occasional basis. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Must be able to detect, distinguish, and determine tastes and smells.In addition, the employee is usually in an indoor professional/retail/customer service setting such as an office and/or cellar with frequent exposure to outdoor conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The employee will frequently ascend/descend stairs.Our company offers competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, a fun rewarding work environment, and flexible work schedules.
