job_descriptions.1714632ec9b256c4: Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeNumber of hires for this role1QualificationsBachelor's (Preferred)Project Management: 2 years (Preferred)Full Job DescriptionOverview: The Marketing Coordinator, Projects & Events plans and executes a variety of projects including logistics packaging and our WIC program for our four different brands - Redwood Hill Farm, Green Valley Creamery, Meyenberg and Tailspring - in alignment with brand positioning, strategy and goals. Additional responsibilities include management of trade shows and events, e-commerce asset support and consumer relations backup. This is a full-time, non-exempt position that reports to the Senior Director of Marketing.Key Responsibilities: Project Management: · Manage logistics of label updates and printing of new packaging using the label change form and process. This includes managing artwork submission to packaging vendor, requesting small edits and revisions as needed, internal routing and approval of artwork and effective communication via email with the packaging team.· Coordinate packaging processes successfully which includes keeping all label binders up-to-date, naming and archiving print proofs to ensure version control. Conduct annual label review and create report for our annual food safety audit.· Manage WIC program (Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants and Children) by keeping images and product information updated, submitting information on new products and tracking WIC approval status in participating states.· In collaboration with the Graphic Designer, support Sales and Marketing team on a variety of projects such as asset updates on e-commerce platforms, creation and shipment of mock-ups, and other projects as needed.Trade Shows & Events: · Coordinate all trade show and event planning and logistics including paperwork, shipping of booth crates, samples & materials, creating staff schedule and dinner reservations and any other critical tasks. Supervise booth set-up and work at the booth as needed to represent the Company.· With the guidance of the Brand Managers, organize branded consumer events with creative inspiration. Order, organize, store and inventory necessary equipment, supplies and materials for trade shows and events.· Support local events and activities as needed, including hotel and restaurant reservations, tours, or other local activities. Help with execution of other internal and company-wide events as needed.Consumer Relations: · Support consumer relations representative by covering as a regular back up or when additional help is needed due to volume, vacation, and other absences.· During this time, act as main point of contact for incoming consumer phone calls, emails, social media messages and letters thereby providing first-line of support for consumer inquiries and requests.· Process product complaints accurately and efficiently by following complaint process and working closely with QA team.Required Competencies (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities): Strong interpersonal and communication skills (verbal & written)Excellent time, project management and problem-solving skillsCapable of working effectively with internal and external teams and partnersAbility to actively listen and accept direction and guidance from superiorsAbility to navigate sensitive situations with diplomacy and good judgementMinimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in marketing, hospitality management, business or communications2-3 years of project management experienceExperience in trade show, event or hospitality management a plusExperience working with CPG packaging and printing vendors preferredAbout Redwood Hill Farm & CreameryRedwood Hill Farm (RHF) is the market-leading, cultured goat milk dairy brand in the U.S. The goat milk for our yogurt and kefir comes from the original Redwood Hill Farm in Sebastopol, California, as well as from seven other family farms. RHF is one of the two dairy brands that are manufactured at our solar-powered creamery that is located only a few miles from the farm.We are a growing, 53-year-old company that was founded in 1968 during the height of the back-to-the-land movement. Since the very beginning, and to this day, we are rooted in the desire to bring wholesome and healthful foods to communities across the country and are guided by our mission of making real dairy available and enjoyable for everyone.Within the Marketing & Sales Team, we accomplish this through the promotion of our portfolio of three specialty dairy brands and one nutritional pet food brand: Redwood Hill Farm (cultured goat milk dairy), Green Valley Creamery (lactose-free, cultured cow milk dairy) Meyenberg (fresh and powdered goat milk) and Tailspring (Milk replacer for puppies and kittens) - the latter two brands are manufactured by our sister company in Turlock.Redwood Hill, Green Valley Creamery and Meyenberg are the market leader in their respective product categories and are distributed nationally across the natural, specialty gourmet and conventional channels. Tailspring is the new kid on the block and was only launched in December of 2020.At Redwood Hill Farm & Creamery, we believe in empowering and growing people within, respecting the animals that generously give us their milk for our products and leaving the earth better than we found it. In fact, Redwood Hill Farm was the first goat dairy in the U.S. to achieve Certified Humane certification in 2005. Our decisions are based on the triple bottom line of profit, people and planet: Our creamery is run 100% on renewable energy; all goat milk we source is Certified Humane and we extensively contribute and engage with our local and like-minded community.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:Project Management: 2 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationCompany's website:https://redwoodhill.com/Company's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/RedwoodHillFarm/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyWork Remotely:NoCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Personal protective equipment provided or requiredPlastic shield at work stationsTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Discount Dance has transitioned to a pure ecommerce model, representing the industry’s top manufactures in addition to several in-house brands. As the owner of the Marketing function, you will report directly to the CEO and drive all aspects of marketing. Initiatives will include brand building, digital marketing, utilization of database analytics, website design and public relations.We are looking for someone who is passionate about marketing, confident with data and continuously searching for creative and effective ideas to grow our business.A Day in the Life · Deliver marketing objectives inclusive of cross functional plans and clear channel approach.· Drive all marketing and promotional campaigns to effectively acquire and retain customers, from strategy and planning to implementation; including but not limited to content development, promotional execution, email marketing, social and digital marketing while managing timelines, deliverables and cost.· Develop and execute a comprehensive marketing strategy encompassing brand awareness, digital marketing, and e-commerce, focusing on revenue generation with short and long-term KPIs.· Continuously optimize creative message strategies to increase performance, testing message content, images, offers, landing pages, frequency, segments, etc.· Create engaging experience for customers on the web site and all social media platforms including email marketing, loyalty programs, landing page optimization, and inbound marketing.· Direct the email marketing program including all promotional, trigger-based, targeted segment campaigns, and service email; Master’s Degree is a plus!· Min. of 5+ years of digital marketing experience working in the lifestyle, active, or direct-to-consumer (DTC) space.· Proven work experience as a digital marketing strategist or digital marketing manager position.· Hands on experience with online marketing tools and practices.· Familiarity with web designMust Haves: · An entrepreneurial spirit that continuously challenges the status quo· The desire to build partnerships in the dance community· Exhibit honesty and kindness in the workplace and create the space for others to do the same.· Integrate fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka don't take yourselves too seriously.What you will get: · A competitive benefit package including:o Medical, dental, vision, Vol Life and FSAo 401k plan with employer matcho Paid Time offo Employee discount, wellness program & activitiesJob Type: Full-timePay: Up to $110,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee discountFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayExperience:Marketing: 5 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Stable -- traditional, stable, strong processesTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeCompany's website:https://www.discountdance.comBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionOne Planet Group , the leading online marketplace for locally-targeted advertising, is seeking a
Search Marketing Analyst, who will fit in to a very fun and fast paced environment, and has the ability to be very hands-on and a team player. This person will play a critical role in driving our profitable growth by being responsible for online traffic acquisition with search engine marketing (SEM) and Pay per Click (PPC) channels across multiple verticals. Candidates should be comfortable with managing multiple Paid Search campaigns and demonstrate a proven track record of maximizing internal KPIs such as profit, revenue, and conversions.
Culture: Woven through One Planet is a culture that values diversity and inclusion, unity, service to humanity, and excellence in all things. This commitment makes One Planet a company that strives to implement best business practices while also seeking to foster an environment that promotes equality, love, and empowerment. As a member of the One Planet team, the potential candidate is expected to be a pillar that exemplifies and reinforces this culture.
Responsibilities:
Plan and implement SEM campaigns and other PPC accounts
Monitor intraday performance, compile daily report, and provide in-depth analysis of the accounts and campaigns. Develop and execute optimization plans and bidding strategies for better ROI
Optimize account performance through on-going effort of keyword expansion, ad copy testing, campaign structure improvement, and bid management.
Maximize click-through rate (CTR), keyword quality score, and conversion rate through best practice and continuous testing effort
Launch, test, and optimize display campaigns through targeting improvements, frequency caps, creative testing, and bid optimization
Assist with landing page optimization strategies and A/B testing to improve performance
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required. Master’s degree a plus.
Logical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Experience managing Paid Search campaigns while maximizing KPIs such as profit and conversions.
Comprehensive understanding of digital marketing and latest Paid Search trends.
Adwords certified a plus.
Experience managing social accounts a plus.
Personal Attributes of the ideal candidate should include:
Positive, energetic, can do, solution oriented, optimistic attitude.
A guerilla sensibility, an appetite for risk, a big thinker.
Team attitude: a willingness to roll up your sleeves, a service approach to leadership, a history of respect for all colleagues and intolerance for politics. We are fun and friendly and look to work with fun and friendly people.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
The Brand Marketing Manager is responsible for leading brand and product marketing strategy/activity across assigned licensed titles within the Disney Games, LucasFilm, Star Wars and Interactive Experiences global portfolio by partnering with licensees to deliver world-class campaigns.

The Marketing Manager owns a portfolio of products within the Games and Interactive Experiences business and helps each licensee successfully create/execute go-to-market plans that build brand awareness, engage consumers, and drive conversions through thoughtful brand storytelling, data-driven insights, and creative innovation – all grounded in a consumer-centric integrated marketing approach.

The Marketing Manager plays an important role within the global Disney Games and Interactive Experiences business with responsibility/oversight for a portfolio of titles and is a strategic/creative marketer with the ability to blend the qualitative and quantitative aspects of marketing to craft a great story.

Responsibilities:
Own a portfolio of titles within the global Disney Games and Interactive Experiences and ensure the successful launch and live operations of these titles in partnership with licensees
Act as the day-to-day lead with licensees in reviewing marketing materials, providing insightful guidance/feedback, and managing/approving go-to-market plans, creative assets, and marketing activations
Be a strong brand steward for Disney, Lucasfilm and Star Wars brands, especially in providing insights/support to licensees and managing executions to ensure flawless marketing and creative implementations
Leverage quantitative and qualitative insights with licensees to identify market opportunities that inform and help shape player personas/target audiences, positioning, go-to-market plans, creative development, and campaign activations
Maintain knowledge of industry trends, competitive market, business opportunities, etc.
Analyze performance of marketing campaigns with licensees regularly to identify areas of optimization and make actionable recommendations
Implement industry best practices with licensees and strive to uphold benchmarks across all marketing campaigns
Deliver on innovative and performance driven Disney Marketing campaigns that extend reach, increase awareness, and result in meaningful brand deposits
Cultivate strong relationships with licensees to facilitate communication
Partner closely with internal cross-functional teams (Production, PR, Franchise, Legal and more) to leverage their expertise throughout all stages of product development.
Serve as the internal brand champion for licensees to help garner support for plans across TWDC
Collaborate with regional teams to implement global strategy via meaningful local campaigns
Present marketing updates to Executives and broader Games and Franchise Teams
Create marketing pitch decks, presentation materials, internal plans, and post-mortems

Basic Qualifications:
3-5+ years of experience in Marketing, combined with 2+ years of working in Online/Media Entertainment (preferably within the gaming industry)
Goal-oriented strategic/creative thinker with a proven track record of taking ownership and driving results
Demonstrated success in brand management, product marketing, user acquisition, and social/community marketing strategies/campaigns
Excellent analytical skills; ability to translate qualitative/quantitative data into actionable insights that tell a story
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to influence and “sell” strategies to a wide audience set
Resourceful problem-solver with a can-do attitude; works well under pressure
Highly organized, detail-oriented project manager; ability to multi-task and prioritize
Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills
Proficiency in Keynote/PowerPoint; the ability to creatively tell a story in a compelling way
Working knowledge of 3rd party tools used to source app market data and competitive insights
Passion for the entertainment industry with a focus on interactive and gaming strongly preferred

Required Education
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
job_descriptions.1177ea0b65d25ed9:
Job detailsSalary$20 an hourJob TypeFull-timeContractFull Job DescriptionBuzzFeed

BuzzFeed is the world's leading independent digital media and tech company, with a cross-platform news and entertainment network that reaches hundreds of millions of people globally and spreads Joy and Truth across the internet.
Our portfolio of brands are household names that people rely on to inform and entertain, including: BuzzFeed, BuzzFeed News, Tasty, Nifty, Bring Me, Cocoa Butter, Pero Like, Worth It, and Unsolved to name a few! These properties and their Creators reach over 134M people a month through articles, lists, videos, animations, quizzes, podcasts, original series, newsletters and more.

The Role

BuzzFeed is seeking a Social Media Associate to join its team in Los Angeles in March or April of 2021. While the Associate will be working remotely, we do require that the work be done from California. Freelancer will primarily provide publishing and editorial support for the BuzzFeed social media team, working primarily for the As/Is, Goodful, BuzzFeed Celeb, & BuzzFeed Animals brands.

The ideal candidate is organized and detail-oriented, enthusiastic about social media, and all things BuzzFeed. We're looking for a data-obsessed self-starter with excellent judgement and communication skills.

This is a contract role, lasting 5 months. The person chosen is expected to work 40 hours per week and will be paid $20/hour.

All application materials will need to be submitted when you apply.

You Will

Assist BuzzFeed social editors with scheduling posts and finding/creating content across platforms.
Read and watch BuzzFeed content and find creative ways to adapt Buzzfeed video content to new platforms.
Optimize content across YouTube, Facebook, Instagram + Instagram Stories, Twitter, and more
Prepare insights for the social and content teams to continuously find best practices for social optimization
Test creative and copy to discover ways to maximize engagement and traffic
Assist with experiments on emerging platforms to strategize new opportunities for revenue
Generate reports/sharing pertinent information across multiple teams

You Have

Proven organizational and administrative experience
Understanding of social platforms, and why content on those platforms became popular.
A positive, curious, playful disposition.
A genuine love for and excitement about the internet (no haters).
Flexible with changing workloads
Previous social and/or e-commerce experience a big plus

All job applications must be received through the official BuzzFeed Jobs board (https://www.buzzfeed.com/about/jobs), including referrals. It is BuzzFeed's practice to not schedule job interviews until after an application is submitted through our jobs board.

Life at BuzzFeed

At BuzzFeed, we believe we benefit from the diverse perspectives within and across our teams. As such, BuzzFeed celebrates inclusion and is committed to equal opportunity employment practices.

BuzzFeed is the world's leading tech-powered media company, with a cross-platform news and entertainment network that reaches hundreds of millions of people globally. The company aims to spread truth and joy across the internet by producing articles, lists, quizzes, videos, original series; lifestyle content through brands including Tasty, the world's largest social food network; original reporting and investigative journalism through BuzzFeed News; strategic partnerships, licensing and product development through BuzzFeed Marketing; and original productions across broadcast, cable, SVOD, film and digital platforms for BuzzFeed Studios.

BuzzFeed is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on age, race, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other protected category.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
Disney Advertising Sales is responsible for advertising sales for the Company’s entertainment, sports, news and kids linear and digital and radio business. Global Ad Operations leads the operational function for the Disney Ad Sales team. The Global Linear Operation team focuses on the function of account management, trafficking, scheduling and sponsorship for the linear business for networks ESPN, ABC, FreeForm, Disney, FX and National Geographic. We are committed to providing a high level of client service to our internal and external clients. We are looking for people who are excited to contribute to a high performing team.

Working at Disney is unlike anything else. When you have the latest technology, game-changing ideas and world-class talent on your team, every day is extraordinary.

The Ad Operations Associate position is responsible to lead and manage television Ad Sales accounts form booking to deal completion. This position will support the sales team to provide account maintenance and client service for the buying agency.

Responsibilities:
Leads all deal account management and maintenance for all their assigned advertisers. This includes day to day point of contact for ad agencies and sales teams, booking commercial inventory, implementing agency requests and changes for their ad schedules, and ensures accuracy with deal points and traffic instructions
Provide ongoing feedback for improved efficiencies
SLAs: Adhere to all department’s Service Level Agreements
Ensure deal dollars are booked and consistent to what the advertiser purchased.
Resolves invoice discrepancies to further our network collection target of 75 day DSO (improves company cash flow)
Work with Accounting to execute pricing adjustments for units post-air and other invoice adjustments as needed
Partner with planning to ensure accuracy of MSA Post materials and provide the agency with insights into their delivery on a quarterly basis or as needed
Responds to evolving business needs, and tasks/projects set forth by management
Will provide peers additional training on either role responsibilities or account specific learning
Maintain and develop strong working relationships with buying agencies, creative agencies, traffic agencies and internal departments supporting Customer Marketing and Sales


Basic Qualifications:
Can operate within the context of highly defined, routine processes and procedures adhering to organizational deadlines
Proven leadership & problem solving skills
Has experience and enjoys both working independently and collaboratively with a team
Interested in working in a fast paced, team environment
Preferred Qualifications:
Relevant internship experience
Required Education
Bachelor's Degree
Additional Information:

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionCommunications Assistant, Direct-to-Consumer
Location Santa Monica, California
Business: HBO
Position Type: Full Time
Job ID 181982BR
Company Overview

WarnerMedia is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, HBO Max, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others.

HBO is one of the most respected and innovative entertainment brands in the world, serving iconic, award-winning programming to 140 million subscribers globally. A subsidiary of WarnerMedia, HBO is the world’s most successful pay TV service with an extensive array of programming that includes some of the most notable titles to be on television, including drama series Succession®, Watchmen®, Westworld®, Big Little Lies®, Game of Thrones®, The Sopranos®, Band of Brothers® and The Wire®, as well as comedy series Barry®, Insecure® and Sex and the City®. HBO is committed to retaining and recruiting skilled and motivated employees, placing a priority on qualified team players who contribute to the diversity of their workforce. HBO offers competitive benefits to include medical, dental, vision, a matched 401(k) plan, flexible spending, a commuter benefit program and tuition reimbursement.
The Job

WarnerMedia seeks a Communications Assistant to support the HBO Max/DTC Comms team. Reporting to the Communications Lead, DTC, the Communications Assistant, DTC, will play a pivotal role in promoting HBO Max to both the industry and consumer press, serving as the connective string tying all of the team’s efforts together.

The Daily

Coverage Reporting & Research:
track coverage of the team’s PR initiatives
create coverage reports and campaign summary decks
conduct research on reporters, publications, and industry trends
Database Maintenance:
manage and update team documents on departmental dashboard
manage and update media lists
maintain database of industry festival and conference opportunities
track executive opportunities and engagements
Administrative Duties:
manage calendar, expenses, travel, etc. for Communications Lead
manage Team PTO calendar
serve as owner of team meeting invites & agendas
collect and communicate team updates to key internal stakeholders

The Essentials

Superior knowledge of Excel, Word, Outlook, GSuite, Presentation/Slideshow applications
Highly detail oriented, organized, efficient, flexible, ability to multi-task
Has a good visual eye and ability to create neat, organized decks and campaign summaries
Ability to keep track of detailed information about the team’s ongoing efforts
Works well under pressure
Self-starter, independent worker, but also a team player
Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Marketing, Public Relations, Journalism, or related field strongly preferred.
Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Description
Zendesk is the market leader in SaaS Customer Service and Engagement solutions for high-growth companies across the world. We are seeking a remote Associate to support Partner Marketing efforts in AMER (U.S. & Canada). Partner Marketing at Zendesk is responsible for planning and executing demand generation campaigns with our strategic partners. In addition, it is responsible for ensuring our partner community is consistently informed of all our events, activities, program updates, and product announcements.
Partner Marketing works closely with Partner Sales to drive growth through partners. An ideal candidate will have a strong interest in marketing and ability to work with a cross-functional team to support go-to-market initiatives. This will be a full-time, remote position.
What you get to do every day:
Provide day-to-day support including requesting purchase approvals, maintaining contact lists, swag orders for new partners, and ad hoc requests from partners for account set-up.
Logistical support for online events, such as assisting with writing program overviews, creating registration pages, preparing event presentations, and supporting event wrap up.
Assist with partner and customer communications and invitations
Shadow Partner Marketing Manager and learn to provide support to Zendesk partners to ensure they have all required sales and marketing resources, including case studies, press releases, data sheets, sales training resources, and more. Assist with planning and execution of monthly co-hosted partner webinars.
Collaborate with cross functional teams, including Partner Sales, Partner Ops, Finance, and Procurement.
Work in tools such as Salesforce, Asana, GSuite, and other internal tools built on Zendesk.
What you bring to the role:
Recently completed a B.S./B.A. with 1+ years of experience in a similar role
Passionate and driven about marketing, cloud based technology, B2B business
Creativity and confidence to try new ideas
Collaborative, upbeat, and a fast learner, willing to jump in to our team’s fast-paced projects and have fun!
Stamina and drive to always push yourself to improve and innovate!
Zendesk builds software for better customer relationships. It empowers organizations to improve customer engagement and better understand their customers. Zendesk products are easy to use and implement. They give organizations the flexibility to move quickly, focus on innovation, and scale with their growth.
More than 150,000 paid customer accounts in over 150 countries and territories use Zendesk products. Based in San Francisco, Zendesk has operations in the United States, Europe, Asia, Australia, and South America.
Interested in knowing what we do in the community? Check out the Zendesk Neighbor Foundation to learn more about how we engage with, and provide support to, our local communities.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionJob Summary:
The Manager, Digital Marketing will assist the overall digital marketing efforts for the Disney+ brand and library campaigns. Reporting to the Director, Digital Marketing, this person will manage the Disney+ brand accounts and will oversee a Social Media Manager. The Manager, Digital Marketing will also assist the Director, Digital Marketing with digital and influencer marketing efforts, while working cross functionally with The Walt Disney Company’s internal stakeholders including Disney Streaming Services, our central digital marketing and product teams, international teams, and our studios and media networks marketing groups. The ideal candidate for this role will have a passion for growing brands and cultivating audiences, all while having a firm grasp on how to acquire and retain subscribers.

Responsibilities:
Develop and lead brand and library campaigns on behalf of the service, and partner with the wider Disney+ Digital Marketing team on initiatives
Partner closely with our analytics team to create and pivot content and campaigns based on data and reporting
Manage agencies and the operations associated with these external partners, including assistance at marketing shoots
Conceive and create evergreen content to complement ongoing brand and library campaigns
Partner closely with the YouTube team on content creation for the Disney+ YouTube channel
Leverage zeitgeist conversation, and encourage fan and talent engagement through content and community management
Stay abreast of social media platform functionality and trends to better inform content creation and strategies
Provide weekly reporting of content performance and campaigns across social platforms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across Disney, Studio, International, the Central Digital Marketing team and partners for support of Disney+ content and campaigns.
Lead and maintain the Disney+ content calendar, working directly with the Social Media Manager
Basic Qualifications:
Possesses strong creative point of view and aesthetic to ensure that Disney+ digital marketing materials are produced at a high level.
Experience with marketing shoots, working directly with talent, and script writing.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, make decisions and change course of action quickly.
Demonstrated ability to manage agencies.
Demonstrated ability to manage teams.
Experience working across multiple mediums – social media, digital placements, and websites.
Keen eye for design, and ability to art direct development of social media and digital creative.
Excellent writing and communication skills.
Passionate about brand management and storytelling, particularly in short form AV or static mediums.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment, juggling multiple projects, and within a matrixed reporting environment.
Excellent interpersonal skills to ensure successful interactions, strong working relationships and the ability to interface with varied levels of management, peers and partners across varying teams.
Highly collaborative sensibility, with ability to be open minded to feedback and always seeking out the best idea, not just their own idea.
Knowledge and experience with social measurement and sentiment tools (both native and third party) as well as the ability to synthesize this data into meaningful results.
Preferred Qualifications:
At least 4 years of extensive experience with digital marketing for brand and entertainment properties.
Worked at either a studio, network, or agency environment with an extensive knowledge of the layers and processes behind digital marketing and social media.
Understanding the business necessities of a startup/launch property – experience defining and creating new systems or processes.
Experience with streaming platform marketing – how a DTC (direct to consumer) product works, and how to make effective digital marketing materials to drive engagement and subscriber growth.
Required Education
Bachelor’s degree. Preferably a degree in Business, Marketing, Digital Marketing, Advertising, Communications, Cinema/Television or related field.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeInternshipFull Job DescriptionJob Description
At Intel's Internet of Things Group, we focus on edge computing in a number of exciting markets adopting new artificial intelligence (AI) technologies and creating enormous business value across many applications. AI at the edge is a rapidly growing field.

This position reports into our Edge AI product marketing and sales/ecosystem enablement team, to assist in product marketing support for our edge computing silicon and software products, with a focus on vision and edge AI applications. Our product marketing team functions as an advisor to the sales force, and closely interacts with engineering, product management, and outbound marketing/communications groups.

Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Creating documentation and various collateral related to our products
Representing the product to customers, ecosystem partners, and internal sales and marketing teams who depend on us for product messaging for events, trainings, sales presentations, and other critical product information
Flexibility to deal with ambiguous and rapidly changing environments
A 'can-do' approach and attitude, willingness to take informed risks in order to achieve desired organization and Intel goals
Quick-learner with an interest in technology
Team work, including across regions is critical in this role
The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits:
Self-motivated individual with strong communication and interpersonal skills that effectively prioritize and deliver to schedule
Excellent communication (both written and verbal) and collaboration skills
Willingness to listen and articulate logically and clearly
Qualifications
Candidate must possess minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. This is an entry level position and will be compensated accordingly.
Candidate must have a Bachelors Degree in Business Administration, Marketing or related field.
Minimum 6+ months of experience in the following areas:
Prior high tech company work experience and/or internships
Quick-learner with an interest in technology
Inside this Business Group
Employees of the Internet of Things Solutions Group (IOTG) have an exciting opportunity before them: To grow Intel's leadership position in the rapidly evolving IoT market by delivering the best silicon, software and services that meet a wide range of customer requirements - from Intel® Xeon® to Intel® Quark®. The group, a fresh, dynamic collaboration between Intel's Intelligent Solutions Group and Wind River Systems, utilizes assets from across all of Intel in such areas as industrial automation, retail, automobiles and aerospace. The IOTG team is dedicated to helping Intel drive the next major growth inflection through productivity and new business models that are emerging as a result of IoT.
Other Locations

Virtual US and Canada

At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We value diversity and inclusion

Job detailsSalary$4,428 - $4,882 a monthJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionLocation: Yuba College - Marysville, CA.

Job Description:
Yuba College is seeking an equity-minded, dynamic, collaborative, and innovative employee to serve as the Student Marketing and Engagement Coordinator .

BASIC FUNCTION : Under the direction of an assigned administrator, coordinate efforts to engage with, recruit, and promote the college to potential and current students with specific attention to engaging with historically minoritized populations. This position will be responsible for college-wide efforts including web content, advertising and branding, social media, event management, and community engagement designed to engage and recruit new students as well as support existing students across our diverse service area. This position will establish data-informed efforts and reach out to potential students through traditional and non-traditional means designed to communicate intentionally and appropriately with our community. This position will work independently, including preparing reports to measure efficiency of advertising campaigns and social media efforts.

Essential Duties Summary:REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES :
Create, coordinate, and execute data-informed advertising campaigns through available media to attract and retain students. Set performance goals for advertising, establish and track outcomes to increase access to college programs, services, events, and activities. Campaigns should be designed to ensure we are reaching out to serve those we are not currently serving.

Design, write, and coordinate the publication of promotional and informational materials in print and digital form such as catalogs, schedules, brochures, news releases, fliers, web, and social media. Materials will be designed to communicate with our community populations including obtaining translations in key languages spoken in service county areas.

Manage college social media accounts including evaluating their outcomes toward student enrollment. Distribute access to the channels to appropriate college offices, ensure posts and content adhere to college brand standards.

Oversee, plan, promote, and execute college and public events, including but not limited to commencement and award ceremonies at the college. Events will be accessible to all attendees, adhere to college brand standards, and designed to enhance the reputation of the college.

In collaboration with college departments, programs, and services, ensure that website content is current, accessible, engaging, and maintains a consistent look and feel.

Draft, coordinate, and distribute messaging to potential and current students through communication tools such as a CRM (Customer Relationships Management) Software, texting tools, social media, and email. Messaging should be focused on reaching the intended audience and eliciting a desired action or response.

Manage vendor contracts to include overseeing, processing, monitoring, and assessing legal contracts; prepare reports and send requested information to all companies that allow Yuba Community College District to publicly perform copyrighted material. Ensure that all appropriate licensure agreements are adhered to and maintained.

Plan and prepare the Public Information,
Public Events, and Commencement budgets, including reviewing reports, maintaining records of expenditures, preparing budget transfers, and processing purchasing requirements to approved procedures over assigned budgets.

Maintain a calendar of events and activities in collaboration with college administration, campus life, fine and performing arts programs, student services, and various community agencies that highlights the college and represents the diverse community within the region.

Analyze, review, and report on the effectiveness of marketing and student engagement activities and campaigns for continual improvement.

Coordinate the photography and video needs and other relevant activities for special college events.

Perform other related duties as assigned.

KNOWLEDE OF :
Correct English usage, grammar, spelling, punctuation and vocabulary.

Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills.

Customer service and communications effective practices.

Principles, techniques, and practices of public relations, marketing and advertising
methods and techniques.

Ability to manage multiple projects from inception to completion.

Knowledge of website and marketing analytics tools.

Policies and objectives of assigned program and activities.

Research and interview techniques, methods, and procedures.

Publication design, editing and writing.

Technical aspects of field of specialty including Internet design and web publishing
Sensitivity to and understanding of the diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, and ethnic backgrounds of community college students, including those with physical or learning disabilities as it relates to differences in learning styles.

Interpersonal skills using tact, patience and courtesy.

Family Education Right to Privacy Act.

ABILITY TO :
Write and edit a variety of materials that are creative, descriptive, technical, and factual.
Coordinate news releases and publications to inform the public, and participants of the programs, services and events.

Operate a desktop or laptop computer and related office equipment such as a copier, fax machine, and printer.

Respond to sensitive matters with discretion and tact.

Assist in promoting programs and services and meeting student needs

Learn, apply, and explain laws, regulations, policies and procedures related to assignment.

Remain abreast of the emerging and changing social media technologies

Establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships with others.

Meet schedules and timelines.

Work independently with little direction and also cooperatively with other departments.

Operate a variety of office equipment including a computer and assigned software.

Maintain records and prepare reports.

Demonstrated skill in multi-tasking, project management, prioritizing workloads, and working independently.

Train and provide work direction to others, i.e. students, temporary employees and/or volunteers.

Establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships with others, including those from a diverse academic, socioeconomic, cultural, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, and ethnic backgrounds of community college students, faculty and staff

Required Qualifications:EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE :
Any combination equivalent to: A bachelors degree in English, Journalism, Marketing, Advertising or a related field; OR Associates Degree with coursework in Visual/ Graphic Design using Adobe Creative Suite or similar software, photography/videography, or web design/ social media with content management software knowledge and two years of increasingly responsible experience in marketing, communications, student or community engagement, journalism, or social media; OR 5 years of increasingly responsible experience in marketing, communications, journalism, or graphic design.

LICENSES AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS :
Drivers license and/or ability to provide own transportation to and from assigned sites.

Desired/Preferred Qualifications:
Physical Demands:PHYSICAL ABILITIES :
Effectively communicating to exchange information in person and on the telephone.
Reading various materials.

Operating a computer keyboard and other modern office equipment.

Sitting, standing, or walking for extended periods of time.

Reaching overhead, above the shoulders and horizontally.

Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard.

Bending at the waist, kneeling or crouching.
Lifting up to 40 lbs.

WORK ENVIRONMENT :
Extensive public contact and customer service experience including contact with potentially dissatisfied individuals.

Collaborative, high traffic educational environment with frequent interruptions and moderate noise levels.

Range/Step: Range 38 CSEA Salary Schedule. Initial placement will not be higher than the salary schedule, the top step for this position is $4582.18/mo.

Salary Range: $4,428.05 - $4,881.92/mo.

Benefits Information:
The District offers a comprehensive benefits package for employees and dependents for positions whose FTE is .60 or higher, valued at over $20,000 annually with a $310.50 monthly out of pocket expense to employees + dependents for their monthly medical premiums. The package includes health, dental, vision, one (1) life insurance policy and an Employee Assistance program. Additional benefits include contributions to the Public Employees Retirement System (PERS) which is integrated with Social Security, 457/403b options, Vacation days 7.33 hrs per month for the first year, 96 hours of vacation leave per years 1-5, 12 sick days and 20 holidays.

This position is anticipated to be assigned to the YUBA COLLEGE but may be assigned temporarily or permanently within the District.

If you require reasonable accommodation to apply for this position, contact Taranjit Chahal at the Office of Human Resources at (530) 741-6979.

WORKING CONDITIONS : Categorically funded positions are contingent upon funding. In accordance to Board Policy, smoking is restricted in many areas of the Yuba Community College District. Yuba College is a tobacco free campus.

WORK DAY, WORK WEEK, and WORK YEAR : The District has the right to establish work day, work week, work year; hours of positions within the District may vary.

INTERVIEW : Candidates selected for an interview will be required to visit Yuba College or Yuba Community College District at his/her own expense upon a date selected by the District. Meeting minimum qualifications does not guarantee an interview.

FOREIGN TRANSCRIPTS : Must include a U.S. evaluation and translation. Contact the Human Resources website for a list of agencies providing foreign transcript services.

PRE-EMPLOYMENT REQUIREMENTS : Employment is dependent upon Department of Justice (DOJ) clearance; all fees are the responsibility of the selected candidates and serves the purpose of obtaining a criminal history as authorized by the California Education Code. All prospective employees shall be required to provide verification of TB test.

EDITION Hotels combine the visionary genius of boutique hotelier Ian Schrager, the service delivery of a world-class luxury hotel, and the global reach of Marriott International to create an entirely new experience in the world of hospitality. Our hotels are stunning microcosms of the world's top cities, featuring the finest in dining, entertainment, nightlife, and service to create an enchanting experience that makes your spirit soar!

But to create this magical experience, we need you.

EDITION is hiring warm, out-going, authentically amazing people who are looking for a place to work that inspires them, challenges them and makes them proud to come to work. A place where service comes from the heart, not from a handbook. A place that delivers a never-ending theatrical performance that continuously delights and enchants each and every one of our guests.

We invite you to join us today.


JOB SUMMARY
Responsible for developing and implementing an ongoing media and community relations program to enhance the property's sales and marketing efforts in order to target market and reinforce the company identity. Provides crisis communications assistance to properties. Ensures information to the public and community is displayed correctly and effectively with the best opportunities for providing business. Develops and implements an ongoing, focused media and community relations program.
CANDIDATE PROFILE
Education and Experience
2-year degree from an accredited university in Marketing, Business Administration, or related major; 4 years experience in public relations, communications, or related professional area.
OR
4-year degree from an accredited university in Marketing, Business Administration, or related major; 2 years experience in public relations, communications, or related professional area.
CORE WORK ACTIVITIES
Building Brand and Property Awareness to Drive Revenue
Works collaboratively with local, regional and national resources to build awareness and increase exposure for the property and restaurants.
Solicits new media outlets and travel media individuals.
Selects the best opportunities for the property based on market conditions and property needs.
Uses creative selling abilities to obtain maximum exposure through travel journalists and media outlets.
Increases awareness within the travel media community as well as coordinating events to gain exposures and grow revenue in the restaurant outlets.
Maintains website content and updates website with new promotions in order to generate additional revenue.
Manages the hotel’s social media efforts, if applicable.
Works with online media outlets to promote the hotel.
Organizes and conducts all photo shoots for web site content.
Coordinates offers and information for all publications and inserts with regard to brand loyalty reward mailings.
Develops brochure and property collateral materials.
Participates in all property imaging work (e.g., signage).
Ensures consistent brand and property message is communicated in all public relations and communications efforts.
Ensures consistency in individual property's voice on all guest touch points and public relations and communications, not only following corporate graphic standards, but also on behalf of the individual property.
Building Successful Relationships
Builds and strengthens relationships with existing and new travel writers and local media to ensure future exposure. Activities include calls, entertainment, FAM trips, trade shows, etc.
Develops relationships within community to strengthen and expand customer base for sales opportunities and additional revenue.
Manages and develops relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
Conducts solicitation and maintenance calls to media.
Develops strong relationships with e-commerce vendors, media, and distribution channels to ensure quality, cost effective creative executions.
Identifies and communicates with distribution channels that can sell distress inventory to drive property occupancy.
Provides all communications channels with creative and unique tools to assist in the public relations and communications of the property.
Acts as liaison between corporate and individual properties in rolling out programs and making sure that properties are taking advantage of all opportunities provided through corporate.
Assists property in developing promotions for various campaigns.
Developing and Coordinating Communication Efforts
Provides accurate, complete and effective communications to visiting journalists, publicity or promotions.
Evaluates new public relations opportunities for the property.
Develops strategic public relations plan for property, includes group, leisure and local efforts.
Manages individual and group media visits.
Identifies and coordinates community service activities in concert with the public image and needs of the resort.
Provides strategic counsel, issues statements and supports Executive Teams at properties.
Creates contracts as required for location photo shoots, trade agreements, etc. with appropriate approvals.
Directs creative print fulfillment; ensures corporate branding standards and legal compliances are met and incorporated into collateral.
Writes all hotel press releases and other content for print media and electronic media.
Providing Exceptional Customer Service
Sets a positive example for guest relations.
Interacts with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels; effectively responds to and handles guest problems and complaints.
Observes service behaviors of employees and provides feedback to individuals and/or managers; continuously strives to improve service performance.
Conducts site inspections with visiting journalists.
Additional Responsibilities
Keeps detailed files and records on all matters relative to property's public materials.
Ensures that property is following all corporate public relations guidelines.

job_descriptions.7b5f8f32fcc72d48:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionMinimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
5 years of experience working freelance, in-house or at creative agencies in a content strategy and/or editorial function
Experience with presentations and translating technical concepts for non-technical users
Preferred qualifications:

Experience planning and executing mid-size cross-channel campaigns
Proficiency with digital measurement tools and demonstrated ability to generate actionable insights from data
Understanding of content strategies and tactics including channels such as blog posts, website copy, film, social media posts, email marketing, thought leadership, executive social and content strategy, events, and ability to stay current amongst those channels
Passion for entrepreneurship and demonstrated knowledge of startups, including digital business models, competitive landscape, emerging trends and venture capital/investment mechanisms
Ability to influence at all levels and work effectively across functions and geographies
About the job
Google for Startups works to level the playing field for startup founders and communities to succeed. We do this by bringing the best of Google’s products, connections, and best practices to startups. As the Content Marketing Manager for Google for Startups, you’ll develop Google’s content strategy to reach and engage startup founders at scale, positioning Google as the most helpful company for them and their growing business. You’ll craft compelling narratives about Google’s products and programs, and their impact on startups and communities, and tailor them to specific audiences and channels. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, external partners, and creative agencies all around the world, you will identify opportunities to source, create, and share content that supports founders and our brand. As a member of Google for Startup’s central team, you’ll own projects with global reach while supporting other teams to go deep with founders in-market, always looking for opportunities to share best practices and drive impact at scale.
Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems-from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can-changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.
Responsibilities
Develop and execute a global content strategy to engage startup founders and communities, and position the Google for Startups network (founders, partners, Googlers, and executives) as influencers within the industry
Manage agency and freelance contributors to craft content for digital channels that will support and build the Google brand
Represent Google for Startups, writing key narratives and providing editorial oversight and guidance to all external communications
Set challenging but achievable goals and measure the impact of content initiatives against team objectives
Understand the needs and interests of various teams across Google, and how to balance them while always putting the user first
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

GLOBAL EMAIL MARKETING SPECIALIST & DEVELOPER

PADI, the global leader in Underwater Exploration, is searching for a full-time

GLOBAL EMAIL MARKETING SPECIALIST & DEVELOPER based at

our satellite offices located in the Orlando FL area.
At this time the role will work remotely due to COVID-19.
PADI offers its employees a unique culture centered upon an active lifestyle, fun

and hardworking colleagues, interesting work, competitive salary and outstanding benefits. We are an

amazing company searching for amazing people to join our team!

Reporting to the Vice President, CRM & Analytics, the Global Email Marketing Specialist &

Developer is responsible for creating and implementing email marketing campaigns to promote a

PADI product or service to increase customer engagement, leads and conversions. They will analyze

effectiveness of each email campaign and make recommendations to increase customer engagement

and improve sales. Develops database queries and makes recommendations for marketing list

segmentation. Works with global email marketing team to monitor list integrity and performance to

ensure high deliverability rate. Determines and establishes email marketing tracks and clear call-to-
actions and adjusts as necessary to maximize campaign performance. Uses judgement to apply

dynamic content to meet personalization goals. Develops and distributes PADI Worldwide campaign

performance reports and includes recommendations for future A/B testing and campaign refinement.

Writes, edits and reviews email and enewsletter copy applying email marketing best practices. Ability

to both write and read Spanish and/or Portuguese fluently is preferred.


What You Will Do
 
Creates email marketing campaigns to promote products or services that apply email
automation technology, A/B testing and dynamic content to improve campaign performance.
 
Analyzes performance of email campaigns and makes recommendations to improve deliverability,
open rates, click-through rates, lead generation and conversions.
 
Develops and populates custom and standardized email templates using HTML responsive
design to ensure usability on desktops, tablets and mobile devices. Able to understand and

utilize AMPScripts as a means of invoking language and other personalizations.
 Creates forms and other functionality using tags and triggers in Google Tag Manager or natively in

Drupal CMS.
 Develops database queries in email marketing software and makes market segmentation

recommendations for testing and to improve performance based upon email reporting

analysis.
 Monitors list integrity and performance within email marketing software to ensure high

deliverability rate and positive online brand reputation.
 Tracks and analyzes electronic media performance and prepares reports to share with MarCom

management and staff.
 Collaborates with marketing consultants and MarCom management to ensure efforts are consistent

with individual product, program or service marketing plans.
 Stays informed and current on email marketing, marketing automation and behavioral marketing

technology trends and best practices.
 Provides copy edit support for email and enewsletter content, applying email marketing best

practices relating to content. Ensures all work follows PADI style guide and editorial policies and

standards.
 Ensures all work follows PADI style guide and editorial policies and standards.
 
Completes special projects and other duties as assigned.


What You Will Need To Be Successful:
 
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) from four-year college or university in Journalism,
Communications, English, or equivalent preferred.
 
Minimum of 5 years’ experience with email marketing, lead nurturing, marketing
automation and web analytics.
 
Excellent understanding of email marketing concepts and metrics such as sender score,
deliverability and sender reputation.
 
Highly experienced and working knowledge of HTML and css for email.
 
Highly analytical and able to derive meaning from data through A/B testing and email
optimization.
 
Excellent writer and communicator (in both the written and verbal form).
 
Extreme attention to detail, organized and process focused.
 
Salesforce email automation and marketing software certification or equivalent a plus.
 
Familiar with Dreamweaver and HTML.

Must be able to demonstrate previous experience by providing a broad sample base of
previous work for review.

PADI Open Water Diver certification or higher, or action sports background preferred.
Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
Must possess excellent organizational and planning skills
Must have a full understanding of media needs and media relationships
Be proactive, reliable, responsible and accurate with attention to detail
Possess a wide degree of creativity and latitude
Self-motivated with a positive and professional approach to work
Founded in 1966, PADI has grown consistently through our 55 years in business, continually raising

the bar for the industry we are all so passionate about. We know who we are as a company but never

let that hold us back from reinventing ourselves and keeping our mission modern and relevant. One

thing that stays consistent is our mission to be “The Way the World Learns to Dive”. PADI has

certified over 28 million divers during our history, an achievement no other scuba diving agency can

claim. We are committed to our purpose to Seek Adventure—Save The Ocean.
PADI strives to create a work environment that respects individual contribution while maintaining a

strong team approach for successful execution of business objectives. The executive team believes in a

work-life balance that enables employees to meet their personal and family needs with flexible hours

and a robust benefits plan.
If this job sounds interesting to you and you meet these requirements described above, we’d like to get

to know you! Please submit your resume & salary requirements to jobs@padi.com. To learn more

about our company visit us at www.padi.com

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionSummary
Posted: Mar 11, 2021
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200229039
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. You bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.
We are looking for an experienced Affiliate Marketer to work on the Apple Services Performance Marketing team supporting growth for Apple TV+ and the Apple TV app. You have both strategic and executional experience with affiliate marketing and know how to manage, grow and optimize global affiliate campaigns.
The role would place you in a highly-energized environment with some of the most talented, creative individuals in the industry where you would be inspired to share your experience along with providing extraordinary support for the team.
Join a growing and spirited marketing team that likes to move fast, test hypotheses and solve problems.
Key Qualifications
2 + year’s experience within the performance marketing industry and experience with third party affiliate tracking platforms
Passion for partner management and finding creative solutions
Experience working with premier brands across multiple markets
A driven interest and initiative to test new partner types and tactics
Strong analytic thinking with ability to relate results to business objectives
Strong verbal, written, analytical and comprehension skills
Proficient in leading multiple projects – ability to multi-task, organize, prioritize and structure workload
Self-starter with a hands-on approach, a good sense of proactivity, prioritization and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
Experience working as part of a global team, understanding the unique needs of different markets
Excellent communication, collaboration, and planning skills with meticulous attention to detail
Attention to detail and a passion for numbers
Experience working within the TV streaming industry a plus
Description
You will partner with your manager and your peers in ownership of the affiliate strategy for video portion of the Apple Services Performance Partners Program. More than just a traditional affiliate program, the Apple Services Performance Partners Program provides unique opportunities for Apple’s valued partners. The video programs objective is to bring new customers to Apple TV+ and the Apple TV app. You will help lead strategic affiliate partner recruitment, delivering results by bringing fresh ideas, managing deliverables, monitoring partner performance and providing recommendations for scale and efficiency within campaigns. This role sits on the larger Digital Marketing team that works across all services and channels. The team is very data-driven, iterates constantly, and vigorously adapts. This is one of the fastest-growing divisions at Apple, designed for someone who is a highly creative, adaptive, and savvy content & performance marketer.
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent preferred.

College/Site: Bakersfield College

Location BC-Main Campus

Basic Function
Under the direction of an assigned supervisor, provide a variety of complex and confidential clerical and secretarial services to college administrators, faculty and staff; to provide information to the faculty, staff, students and public; to provide complex staff assistance to departments.

DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS:

The Department Assistant III provides specialized clerical support requiring a broad knowledge of an assigned program or functional area. Incumbents are typically assigned to a functional area where use of independent judgment requires related specialized training and experience.

REPRESENTATIVE DUTIES:

Perform general secretarial and clerical work; schedule appointments and process personnel information; monitor, order, distribute and maintain office supplies; order textbooks; maintain and troubleshoot new equipment; receive and sort mail.

Type and proofread a wide variety of reports, letters, projects and proposals; compose correspondence related to assigned responsibilities; assist in preparing and typing course outlines and catalog information including class and final examination schedule information.

Participate in the planning, development and implementation of a variety of events and functions directly related to area of responsibility, including fund raising and special events related to college programs.

Assign work activities, projects and programs to clerical and student help; monitor work flow; review and evaluate work products, methods and procedures; participate in the selection of clerical or student staff; assist in staff training.

Perform a variety of work involved in student assistance including scheduling classes; arrange special accommodations such as testing or audiovisual equipment; inform students of class cancellations; transfer students.

Prepare a variety of reports and requests such as travel request forms and faculty request forms; prepare monthly payroll; report teacher absences; verify student assistants’ time cards; issue, receive, type and process various applications, permits and other forms.

Organize and maintain filing systems; maintain a variety of files and record logs directly related to area of assignment including certificated and classified employee files, budget information, student rehabilitation progress and general student files.

Receive and deliver supplies; verify incoming shipments for appropriate quantity and quality; record receipt of merchandise on purchase order; file purchase order; forward purchase orders to District office for partial or full payment; send District updated inventory list.

Respond to supply and material delivery problems; identify shipping problems and return goods shipped in error to vendors.

Assist in reviewing outgoing correspondence and reports for accuracy, completeness and compliance with established standards; participate in the development of program newsletters.

Maintain calendars and schedules of activities, meetings, interviews and appointments; coordinate activities with other departments, various Board and committee members, the public and outside agencies; maintain departmental bulletin board.

Review materials for completeness and conformance with established regulations and procedures; apply applicable policies and procedures in determining completeness of applications, records and reports; provide information and forms to the public; collect and process appropriate information.

Serve as a receptionist; answer the telephone and provide information to students, other offices and the general public regarding the College’s policies and procedures as required; provide information on classes, instructors and schedules.

Participate in budget preparation and administration; prepare cost estimates for budget recommendations; submit justifications for budget items; prepare requisitions for supplies and equipment for all specially funded projects; monitor and control expenditures.

Exercise functional and technical supervision over clerical and secretarial staff and student assistants.

Perform related duties as assigned; duties performed at extension sites may be diverse and varied.

Education and Experience
Any combination equivalent to: Graduation from high school AND three years of responsible clerical experience.

Note: Degrees and credits must be from accredited institutions (Title V Section 53406). Any degree from a country other than the United States, including Canada and Great Britain, must be evaluated by an evaluation service.

Note: The screening of candidates will be conducted by a screening committee. The screening committee reserves the right to limit the number of interviews granted. Meeting the minimum qualifications for a position does not assure the applicant of an interview.

Note: The District is strongly committed to achieving staff diversity and the principles of equal employment opportunity. The District encourages a diverse pool of applicants and does not discriminate on the basis of national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, gender expression, race or ethnicity, color, medical condition, genetic information, ancestry, sexual orientation, marital status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, or because he/she is perceived to have one or more of the foregoing characteristics, or based on association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law, in any of its policies, procedures or practices.
Discrimination Free Work Environment

Knowledge and Abilities
KNOWLEDGE OF:

Modern office procedures, methods and computer equipment.
Word processing methods, techniques and programs.
Correct English usage, spelling, grammar and punctuation.
Principles of budget administration.
Basic arithmetic.

ABILITY TO:

Learn, interpret and apply the policies and procedures of the District.
Perform general clerical work including maintenance of appropriate records and compiling information for reports.
Work courteously with students and the general public on the telephone or in person.
Assist in budget preparation, monitoring and administration.
Perform simple mathematical calculations.
Operate a variety of office machines including a computer and applicable software.
Understand and follow oral and written direction.
Communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
Establish and maintain cooperative and effective working relationships with others.

Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionThe Marketing associate would work directly with the President to execute his vision for the companies identity or image. They will execute this vision through a variety of promotional mediums and provide analytics and results.
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Social media marketing - creating, managing and growing Gold Drop
presence through the blog, Instagram, SnapChat, and other strategically relevant online properties.
Branding - helping to concept collateral materials for our customers and partners
Guerilla marketing - digging in and coming up memorable campaigns to build brand awareness.
Content creation/ community management - writing relevant blog posts and articles, developing a newsletter, and crafting communications and sales materials.
Events and event planning - running any events (press, launch) in our current and original cities, working with local non-profits on cross promotions.
Public relations - managing incoming media requests and building relationships with industry journalists and influencers; creating, executing and measuring media campaigns; eventually hiring a PR agency to augment our growth.
Manage inbound email requests for info account
Customer relations - work as Customer Service team to make sure inquiries get answered
Ambassador program - help build out a fun and effective ambassador program to coincide with each city launch.
 Analytics- Using Google Analytics and other measurement tools to provide reports on metrics, and continually find ways to improve on those metrics through testing and new initiatives.
Business development - some business development outreach and marketing support.
Website- update website content with events, community, awards, PR and new content.

job_descriptions.54ec3654e11f1f17:
Job detailsJob TypeFull-timeFull Job DescriptionSUMMARY
Hulu's Content Marketing team is seeking a Creative Marketing Lead to join our group. You will be a content marketing guru with a track record of driving groundbreaking creative and never-before-seen audience engagement activities for TV series and/or films. This role will highlight your creativity and understanding of marketing channels to deliver breakthrough campaigns that generate a groundswell of love and fandom for entertainment properties. You are committed to making Hulu the number one destination for TV both in and out of the home, while embracing fun. If you are a creative dynamo who thrives in fast-pace environments that emphasize collaboration, communication, and commitment on all levels, and someone who enjoys combining world-class entertainment with advanced technology, then this is a great role for you!
WHAT YOU'LL DO
Define the creative look and feel of all content campaigns in partnership with internal strategic and cross functional partners.
Drive creative direction and development with both internal and external agencies and production partners.
Develop tactics that bring cultural relevance to our shows among targeted audiences.
Identify new channels and first-to-market opportunities for our content brands to activate while providing a logical framework for future innovation.
Win support for your campaign ideas from all relevant partners, including Hulu executives and external talent.
Manage relationships with cross functional teams to execute campaigns; in particular, coordinate tightly with other marketing functions, including brand marketing, social, creative and PR to ensure campaigns fit with overall brand initiatives and communications timelines
Guide on-set photo shoots, directing and producing talent and production to execute pre-set creative objectives.
WHAT TO BRING
10+ years of experience marketing content with a proven record of strong creative judgment to engage a mass audience.
Ability to think strategically and innovate in both established and new mediums.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to craft story and represent it to executives, team members, and outside agencies.
Experience managing creative budgets and systems.
A genuine love for television and desire to change the status quo.
NICE-TO-HAVES
Awards focused creative experience
Experience within a subscription-based business a plus but not required.
Copywriting, scripting, and proofreading acumen.
Understanding of Paid-ads, ratings systems, and legal clearance procedures.
